They REALLY need to train their servers to be knowledgeable about wine. They also need to start carrying higher end liquor and spirits...I expect this type of stuff to be table stakes. Any actual fine dining restaurant that's worth its salt would showcase this. 

We went for Valentine's Day in February which was a lovely meal along with nice entertainment care of the piano guy. We've enjoyed his shows more than one time and he's excellent so don't forget to tip him!

All in all I would say Oakland Hall Inn is "ok".  I find it hard to compare it with the actual fine dining spots I like in the city, but they are doing well as the only game in town.

We had a dinner for six where everyone was disappointed. Both the 5oz and 10oz tenderloin was over done and grisly, the shrimp wasn't tasty, the duck was plain and smothered in a blueberry sauce (which was OK but way too much) that over powered the duck itself.

The dinning room was very hot as they AC was turned down to accommodate the dinner who sat near the one vent in the room. 

There is better for much less elsewhere.

I booked this place for my mom's 60th's birthday and was happy with the turnout.  For our party of 13, I selected Dinner Set A (from their website) and substituted the dessert for Creme Brulee instead of the listed one.  

The starter was a Tomato Bacon soup which was excellent.  Flavourful and not too salty.  For the main course, I had Chicken Ballentine stuffed with mushrooms & Goat Cheese, served with a Merlot sauce.  This was AMAZING.  I usually find chicken prepared at restaurant - especially white meat - dry.  But Oakland Hall Inn did a great job of making sure the meat was tender and moist.  

Dessert was the most disappoint part.  Now, I'm not an expert on creme brulee but I'm pretty sure a nice warm brulee is better than a cold one.  The creme brulee was cold and topped with fruit.  I would have much preferred if it was warm and melted in my mouth.  Meh you can't win them all.

The atmosphere of the restaurant was amazing.  It's in a 18th century house which makes it cozy with a lovely warm ambiance.  It was a bit difficult to find for my guests because it's hidden right after an intersection and up a little.  

Overall, great place.  A tad bit too pricey for an everyday meal but great for special occasions.

As mentioned by other reviewers, Oakland Hall is pricey. For the food it would be overpriced although everything they offer is exceptional. What justifies the extra price is the ambiance. The restaurant is set in an old home built in 1865 set on a hill at the corner of Yonge Street and Saint John Sideroad in Aurora. 

I most recently visited with my wife for Valentine's Day. We sat in the solarium and were serenaded by David who played romantic songs on a grand piano.  The service was superb and we were never left waiting. Although we were there for a total of 90 minutes, the time flew and the food delivery was perfectly timed.

I highly recommend Oakland Hall a rememberable, special occasion where the Keg just isn't good enough.

I finally got around to coming here. I was unsure how the food and service would be after having read the other reviews. In terms of the restaurants I. Newmarket /aurora it is one of the best meals that I have had locally. They were very accommodating in meeting my dietary needs. Their raspberry dressing for Thor garden salad was outstanding.  The only criticism I can make is the food is over priced. My fish entree was $36 for 2.5 ounces of salmon, two scallops and one shrimp with veggies and rice.  I would go again but I would reserve my visit to special occasions due to pricing.

I have known the owner, and this company for a long time, they are amazing! 
Their service works! They use products that do not poison the environment, pets or children. They have a fantastic record for scorpion control; I loved having them as my pest control company when I had my home and had chickens. I felt confident that my animals would not be poisoned! :)
Ladybug Pest control does not stick you with a contract, as many other pest control companies do, and that is awesome. Their services are affordable, dependable and effective. They were doing environmentally friendly  BEFORE anyone else did so they have great expertise on the product they use. 
Love Ladybug and will recommend this company to anyone!

Best deal in town
non toxic bug treatment
we really only get big nasty sewer roaches oweeeeee
and sugar ants
they come when you need them
no contracts
great customer service!
Great company, I used them for a terrible ant problem in my garage. Do not hesitate to call ladybug!
They're customer service is horrible and I would never suggest this company until they correct it. Techs are great, it's the office that has know clue.

Stay away from this company. They are nothing but a bunch of crooks. As u can see only their friends and family are giving them 5 stars. They just recently reported me to a collection agency for an unknown reason. They said I owed them $129, even tho I have been paying their exterminators cash, every time they came to my house to spray it. When contacted they said they have been sending me bills via mail, which I have never received. Their exterminators must have been pocketing the cash and telling their employer that I didn't pay.  The only reason I gave them 1 star is because 0 is not an option.

Safe for my animals (dog and chickens) and works.  A bit of a challenge to schedule, but then they were here within the agreed upon time frame and, as had been my prior experience, the stuff works.  The last irrigation seemed to have brought in some roaches...major yuck factor.  Within a few hours, I found a few dead roaches...which is what I want!  As well, the heat seems to bring sugar ants and I have faith that they will go away.  

I had used Ladybug at my prior house and they have always been pet safe - and with free-range chickens and a dog, that's very important.

Along with recommendations from my friends via Facebook, Yelp, and Google (all fantastic reviews) on where to buy reasonably priced extensions, came across this place. Looks a little ghetto from the outside and in, but a very nice woman helped me pick out a pair of back synthetic hair extensions. I purchased two packs at 20 bucks a piece and I really only needed one. Then I cut them to look more realistic, and they even took well to my curling iron on a low setting. I have a between a chin and shoulder length bob. Cut the extensions to reach slightly below my collar bone. (Pics included). 

Would definitely recommend on service, product selection, and price.

As a first time shopper, I was impressed with the selection of supplies!  Wigs, extensions, & hair care items all at a good value.  Staff was very helpful.  I couldn't help but notice their "wall of shame" display of prior shoplifters up front.  It's sad they have to do it, but I completely understand their need to deter future problems.  I'll happily return for my next batch of extension supplies.

This place has major supplies for almost any beauty need at the lowest price.  I got one of my friends to start wearing wigs and I took her there and she absolutely loves it.  The staff is actually very nice and helpful, but sometimes I feel like they are watching me like I am going to shoplift.  The area isn't the greatest so perhaps they see more theft in that neck of the woods, so it is understandable.  They have tons of hair, lace fronts, half fronts, basic wigs, etc.  TONS of costume jewelery and a wide selection of rhinestones that can add a little sparkle to your look.  There is so much more to write about this place, for the better, but I can't even say it right now because the place is full of so many supplies it's hard to remember everything!
Dr. Matt is awesome.

After trying a few different vets in the oakville area , ive found a vet im thrilled with at oakpark. I live on the other side of oakville but its worth the drive. 
What i love about them.
Dr. Matt, Dr. Laura and Dr. Jenn are all amazing vets but more so they are all good people. What i respect about them is they are always honest and looking into your pets best interest.  

Long story but ill make it short, first came to Dr Matt because my previous vet insisted on a surgery that would cause my dog a ton of pain with a major surgery and for $1400, money wasnt my issue but my dogs well being was. I told them i'd rather spend $5000 on a smaller procedure that would cause less pain but to no avail and i felt they didnt care about looking into different options. I starting asking other dog owners in my neighbourhood an i was told the vets at oakpark have a good reputation for doing what best for animals so i went there for a opinion.  Dr Matt and Dr Laura said they can preform a far smaller procedure that will cause my dog far less pain and recovery time. The surgery went great and costed me only $600 but most importantly my pup bounced back the same day and i couldnt be happier with oak park so i stayed there.  As a client there you get the assurence they have a vast amount of experience and that they are animal lovers who are commited to you pets well being even if it means less profit and that is a rare find. 

They are great at reminding you about upcoming shots that are due and other prevention programs like dental month, hart worm season and so on but what i find very impressive is that they will never push a vacination nor make you feel guilty about the ones you choose to pass on.  All in all this is a great clinic that cares about animals and the experience they offer lets you rest assured that your pet will be the best hands possible. You can read their online bios and youll see how commited these doctors are to their practice.

From the doctors to the fromt line staff to the ones who look after the dogs in the boarding area, everyone at this clinic that i've met has been very good to deal with and when i call with short notice they always find away to fit me in the same day. Would never go anywhere else

Ive sent a few friends over to oakpark because they werent happy where they were and everyone i sent there has stayed there and have been thrilled about the service they get there. Thank you everyone at oak park pet hospital for the great service and peice of mind that my dogs are always in great hands.

With so many vets around, it can become stressful trying to find the perfect fit - I had an amazing one in Toronto but the 1-2 hour drive depending on traffic was becoming too much.
I am so happy I found these guys last year. I have been quite a few times and every single person I have dealt with from the girls answering the phone to the technicians to the vets are amazing. They really do care and always go out of their way to make you and your pet feel comfortable, calm and valued as a customer. I don't pay much attention to the cost of medications but I did right away notice that their prices were considerably less than what I had been paying at another clinic. The facility is new and completely spotless at all times. You will not be disappointed!

Der Schicksalsbrunnen in Stuttgart ist einer meiner Lieblingsbrunnen. Er befindet sich im Oberen Schlossgarten direkt vor dem Stuttgarter Staatstheater. Der Stuttgarter Bildhauer Karl Donndorf erbaute den Brunnen 1914 im Jugendstil.


 Der Standpunkt des Brunnens ist nicht gerade auffällig. Vermutlich wissen nicht viele den Namen des Brunnens, noch weniger die Details die er zeigt. Dabei besitzt er meiner Meinung nach so viel Aussagekraft und stellt das worum es geht - nämlich das Schicksal - wundervoll dar.


 Der Brunnen ist ist ein Halbrund, an dessen Enden sich zwei Paare befinden. Auf der einen Seite ein glückliches Paar und auf der anderen Seite ein trauriges Paar. Die verschiedenen Emotionen werden durch die Haltung schön eingefangen. In der Mitte des Bogens sitzt die Schicksalsgöttin. Sie hat iher Arme weit ausgestreckt, die Hände sind allerdings verschlossen. Denn das Schicksal der Menschen bleibt verborgen.


 (Siehe Foto unten) Inschrift: Aus des Schicksals dunkler Quelle - Rinnt das wechselvolle Los - Heute stehst du fest und groß - Morgen wankst du auf der Welle


 Auch wenn der Brunnen inzwischen einige wenige witterungsbedingte Schäden genommen hat, fasziniert er mich noch immer und ich bleibe gerne davor stehen und betrachte die Figuren. Fotografiert habe ich den Brunnen sicherlich auch schon mal, die Bilder habe ich im Moment aber nicht zur Hand 
Update: ... und jetzt habe ich auch einige Bilder hochgeladen.


 Der Link (http://www.stuttgart.de/sde/item/gen/31628.htm) führt zu einem weiteren Foto und einer Beschreibung. Noch besser ist es natürlich, man schaut selbst einmal vorbei, wenn es möglich ist (immerhin ist der Weg vom Hauptbahnhof ja kurz).

Der Brunnen ist ganz schön mit seinen Verzierungen, aber es sollte drauf geachtet werden, dass so etwas Schönes nicht der Witterung zum Opfer fällt. Ich bin mal gespannt, wie sich mein Schicksal entwickeln wird :)

Trauriges Künstlerschicksal inspiriert zu schönem Brunnen


 Der weiße Schicksalsbrunnen von Donndorf ist einer der unspektatuläreren, aber sehr schönen Brunnen und befindet sich im Oberen Schloßgarten.


 Donndorf schuf den Brunnen zum Gedenken an die von ihm verehrte Opernsängerin Anna Sutter. Die Arme wurde nämlich von einem früheren Liebhaber ermordet. Der Brunnen wurde 1914 am Künstlereingang der damaligen Württembergischen Staatsoper erbaut und in den Sechzigern auf die andere Seite des Gebäudes an seinen heutigen Standort zwischen Oper und Schauspiel versetzt. Er ist von Mai bis Mitte September in Betrieb.


 Bilder wurden ja schon von einem Vorposter eingestellt, auch eine Beschreibung. Es ist ein Ort, an dem man sehr gut nachdenken kann und die schönen Figuren, die Freud und Leid eines Paares darstellen, sind des genaue Anschauen wohl wert.


 Und der Spruch auf dem Brunnen...


 AUS DES SCHICKSALS DUNKLER QUELLE RINNT DAS WECHSELVOLLE LOS
HEUTE STEHST DU FEST UND GROSS, MORGEN WANKST DU AUF DER WELLE


 ...... ist zwar kein Meisterwerk der Dichtkunst, lässt einen aber mal kurz zusammenschauern.


 Nachsatz: auf mehrmalige Fragen, Näheres zu Frau Sutter:
Die Sängerin war an sich überhaupt keine Schönheit aber wohl ein ganz heißer Feger, der nun überhaupt nichts anbrennen ließ. Ab 1893 hatte sie ein festes Engagement am Stuttgarter Hoftheater. Neben ihrer Sangeskunst sorgten auch diverse Liebesaffären für Schlagzeilen. Sie hatte zwei uneheliche Kinder von dem Freiherrn von Entress-Fürsteneck und dem Hofkapellmeister Hugo Reichenberger. Ihre Affäre mit dem nächsten Hofkapellmeister, Aloys Obrist, wurde ihr zum Verhängnis: sie schickte ihn nach zwei Jahren in die Wüste und er erschoß daraufhin sie und sich.

Mit denen war ich eigentlich immer sehr zufrieden, als ich noch Mitglied gewesen bin.


 Panne. Ein Anruf und jemand war sofort am Telefon. Wartezeit - knapp 30 Minuten. Das ist auch noch ok.


 Freundliche Helfer rundeten das Gesamtbild ab.

Ich habe es ja bereits in meinem Feedback an 741 angeschnitten - ich bin seit 6 Jahren ein zufriedenes ACE-Mitglied. Der Service im Pannenfall hat bei allen von unseren 4 Pannen richtig flott funktioniert und mein Mann und ich sind freundlich und fachmännisch betreut worden. Ich finde es zudem super, dass wir keine zusätzliche Mitgliedschaft für meinen mein Mann abschließen mussten, der kann nämlich alle Leistungen meiner Mitgliedschaft mitnutzen (ohne mehr bezahlen zu müssen). Außerdem bin ich begeistert, dass der ACE ein Beschwerdemanagement hat. Das zeigt mir, dass der ACE hören will, was seine Mitglieder zu sagen haben.

Bin schon seit über 20 Jahren Mitglied und wurde bisher nicht 
enttäuscht. Ganz gleich ob bei der Pannenhilfe oder in der ACE eigenen 
Werkstatt. Für ACE Mitglied sind Fahrzeugchecks übrigens kostenfrei, man
 bekommt hinterher ein Prüfprotokol auf dem man sehen kann wie es um sein Heilix Blechle bestellt ist.
Wenn mein Auto übrigens abgeschleppt werden mußte, dann habe ich gleich 
gesagt zum ACE. So eine Erfahrung wie 741 ist eine Ausnahem und nicht 
die Regel und hat, wie Lakula richtig bemerkt, nicht direkt was mit dem ACE zu tun.

ich kann nizza nur zustimmen. offensichtlich macht in dem laden jeder was er will, Leistungen werden nicht laut leistungsprofil erstattet sondern nach lust und laune. wer behauptet das die essentielle aufgabe eines autoclubs beim ace, die pannenhilfe, bestens funktioniert der fantasiert. nicht einmal ausserhalb der urlaubszeit kriegen die das gebacken. wozu brauche ich denn einen autoclub? er soll mir helfen wenn ich liegen bleibe. wenn das nicht funktioniert kann ich drauf verzichten. dumme Sprüche und eine glorifizierte Selbstdarstellung helfen mir auf der Strasse nicht weiter. 
in dem laden regiert groessenwahn gepaart mit Unvermögen, die bilden sich tatsächlich ein dem adac Konkurrenz bieten zu können.

mein atriebriemen war gerisse , ich rufe automobilclub ACE an und die firma strang hat mein auto ca. 20 km weit gefahren zur eigenen werkstatt. ich hatte par mal angerufen . die wollten alles wechsel ich sagte riemen reicht. er sagt das kann man nur im set kaufen. ich wollte vorbeikommen und ein riemen von atu bringen. er ist stinke sauer geworden und hat gesagt: wir machen nichts mehr ,holen sie ihr auto ab. ich will mein auto abholen und musste über 120 euro bezahlen nur für fehlersuche und riemenabbau. die hatten mehr kaputt gemacht als es vorher war. und bei ace haben die behauptet, ich wolle einen riemen vom schrottplatz bringen. ace ist partner mit strang und hat auch nicht machen wollen um mir zu helfen

Ich kenne keinen schlechteren Automobilclub. Wer im ACE Mitglied ist, der muss Leidensfähigkeit mitbringen. Die Leistungen sind zwar nicht schlecht, aber schlecht zu bekommen. Ich hatte heute eine Automobilpanne, habe den Wagen aber nicht vom ACE abschleppen lassen, sondern einen Abschlepper über die Mobilitätsgarantie meiner Werkstatt beauftragt. Dort hat man aber keinen Mietwagenanspruch. Den wollte ich einfach geltend machen, indem ich die Panne melde. Die Dame am Telefon tat sehr verwundert, dass ich keine Abschlepphilfe brauche, sondern nur meiner vertraglichen Pflicht genüge tun möchte, den Anspruch rechtzeitig anzumelden. Sie meinte gleich in perfekter Versicherungs-Abwimmel-Manier, Mietwagen gäbe es nicht bei Geschäftsreisen. Davon war nie die Rede. Die Reise war privat. Drohend: Wir werden Ihren Anspruch überprüfen. Schon gut, ich werde meinen Anspruch schriftlich anmelden, dann können Sie prüfen. Die Haltung ist ganz klar: Erstmal abwimmeln. Sehr, sehr merkwürdig.
Die freie Tankstelle des Autoclub Europa ist immer ein paar Cent preiswerter als andere Tanken. Neuerdings auch mit Tankautomat.

Its a place where you can get a big burger, get greasy fries, and guzzle it down with a can of pop / milk shake.  They serve a pretty mean chicken souvlaki and gyro which is cut right off the spigit.

This is what i remembered about the place... you would find the people who worked at Licks coming here to have a bite to eat.  This place would be open late at 2am and it would be filled with people having a craving for some comfort food after leaving the clubs with friends.

I have fond memories eating here with friends when we just wanted  a place to chat and it was well past midnight.

Came here super hungover looking for breakfast which is scarce in this area.

The place is super dirty and scary. 

We all ordered the Breakfast Combo:

3 Eggs - Sunnyside up (eggs are eggs right)
Homefries - They were okay. No salt of anything.
Sausage - Overcooked and scary looking!
Toast - Toast was toast. Too much margarine though.

Probs won't come back here again. It was scary.

Though, kudos to the lady at the front who was both the waitress and the cook. Double Duty. 


9/15

A few of us went there the other day for lunch the other day.  It's not a big place, seats about 20 people and basically you order and wait.  Whilst waiting, I took a good look around and man, could this place need a good cleaning!

We ordered the basics... burgers, hot dogs, fries and onion rings.  You order the toppings you want ahead of time and they dress your burger / hot dog for you.  The toppings seemed to be plentiful on both... at least, I had no complaints.

The lady manning the counter was doing double-duty as the cook which made for slow (but not unreasonable) service.  When our food was ready we all set to dive into to some greasy comfort food!  Hmm.  I didn't quite satisfy that craving.

The food was, well, sorta... meh.  Their burgers are large and cooked thoroughly, their hot dogs lack flavour... a street vendor would be your better bet (note: there's one just around the corner at the GO station).

The fries 'appeared' to be hand cut but were under cooked and had a real 'potato-ee' texture and flavour.  They were really just... kinda... 'non-descript'.  And the onion rings?  Oh my.  They were so oily and heavy tasting... and so over cooked that I think the onion actually dissolved in a few of them.

I'm afraid the two-star 'Meh. I've experience better.' rating will have to do for now.

Recently I began coming to middleburg's location over my home's location in Parma. For a few reasons, their produce seems to be fresher on most occasions. Also the staff seems a bit more willing to help. The biggest positive at this location is that they actually unlock the baby formula, which saves me 5 minutes of looking for an employee, who then has to look for a co worker to come unlock it. It's Giant Eagle so i can't go on and on. But in terms of preferred locations I'd choose this one over quite a few others.

Pretty slick store.

Came into get some snacks. Their decorations (and merchandise) starts before you even get in, with potted plants on the front end- for decoration and sale. Walking in, they have everything stocked, clean, and nicely arranged.

Fresh area was very well stocked (on a Saturday night?! It never looks this nice, anywhere!) and the floors were clean. Not just basic mopping and waxing, but no debris, messes, clearly these people not only have an attention to maintenance, but they clean as they go. They either care, or there are consequences for associates not giving a poop.

Everything in the store was in stock, and I didn't notice a thing out. Good selections on my weird healthful foods, and well sorted. 

If I was in the area, and traffic wasn't crazy in here, I could see this being my regular grocery go to.

This is a hidden gem of a discount store located at the end of a strip mall. I worry that it gets passed up because of it's location. It is definitely a store that caters more towards the mature crowd but if you look, you can find some great trendy and cute pieces here. Today I found a Max Edition (a discount line of BCBG) top and dress pants for $75 bucks. Steinmart is more organized and shoppable than Tj Maxx or Ross so that makes the experience more enjoyable.

Some of the housewares here are also very nice. I think it would be a good place to find gift items for birthdays or holidays. Customer service was good. I would definitely shop here in the future.
Always a fun store! Nice employees,  helpful and friendly. Great selection of merchandise, and good sales.
Really awesome store always clean and stocked, the employees always so helpful and just give a good vibe. I drink from downtown phoenix just to shop at this store.

Kann dem ersten Schreiben voll und ganz nachvollziehen. 
Der Chef geht mit seinem Kunden um als ob man Bittsteller ist.
Andere Preis am Telefon vereinbart, nach der Montage verlangte er 16,- EUR mehr als vereinbart. Er stellte mich vor die Wahl zahlen oder ich bekomme
meinen Schlüssel nicht.
Das alles mit einer sehr agressiven Art.


 Macht einen Bogen um diesen Laden, man kriegt in Ludwigsburg auch anderswo gute günstige Reifen.


 Ich bin Kunde und nicht König, aber in diesem agressiven Ton und sich nicht an telefonischen Vereinbarung halte und dann obendrein auch noch drohen.


 Finger weg!!!
Ich war Samstag kurz vor Ladenschluß bei Pneumaster und man tat alles damit ich meine Urlaubsreise trotz Panne fortsetzen konnte. Sehr zu empfehlen !

Ich ließ mir einen Termin für eine Reparatur geben und brachte mein Fahrzeug zu dieser Uhrzeit zu AMS. Zum Glück komme ich von dort zu Fuß ins Geschäft. Als ich bis kurz vor Ladenschluss keinen Anruf erhielt, wie der Status der Reparatur sei, rief ich von der Arbeit aus dort an und fragte nach. Ein genervter Mitarbeiter antwortete: Was rufen Sie mich da an? Wir melden uns dann schon bei Ihnen, wenn wir fertig sind!
Also durfte ich zusehen, wie ich heim komme. Am nächsten Tag haben dann die Busse gestreikt und es dauerte Ewigkeiten, bis ich bei der Arbeit war. Bis zum Abend hörte ich nichts mehr von AMS, aber erneut anzurufen traute ich mich nicht. Zum Glück nahm eine Kollegin einen extremen Umweg auf sich und brachte mich heim. 
Am nächsten Tag rief ich abends dann doch an. Nach drei Tagen sollte man doch was wissen. Ein Mitarbeiter teilte mir dann mit: Oh! Ihr Auto haben wir völlig vergessen! Wir haben noch gar nichts daran gemacht. Ob man denn mirgen dazu komme, fragte ich. Nein antwortete man mir. Diese Woche nicht mehr.
Wütend ging ich dann dort vorbei und holte mein Auto ab. Nicht mit mir! Jetzt kümmert sich eine andere Werkstatt darum und es wurde festgestellt, dass die von AMS veranschlagte Reparatur ohnehin unnötig gewesen wäre. Wenigstens hatte ich durch die Aktion Geld gespart.

Vorsicht vor diesem Anbieter!!! Der Preis mag zwar günstig erscheinen, dafür bekommt man was man spart 1:1 durch den mehr als mangelhaften Kundenumgang zurück. Investiert lieber 50 EUR mehr und geht zu einer Werktstatt, bei dem der Kunde noch König ist. Ich wurde da mehrmals vom Chef mit lauter Stimme angeschnauzt... sowas geht gar nicht! Macht einen großen Bogen um diesen Laden... es gibt genug andere Werkstätte in der Nähe (ATZ, ATU etc...)


 Ich war gerade Bremsen machen lassen und neue Reifen auf die Felgen montieren lassen. Nach 2,5h Arbeit hieß es: "wir schließen nun den Laden für eine Stunde, kommen Sie später wieder - dann machen wir ihr Atuo fertig!" o_O wo sollte ich denn ohne Auto hin?!? Dass die ganze Zeit meine Reifen nur da lagen, während einer die Bremsen gemacht hat, anstatt dass ein Zweiter die neuen Reifen schon mal auf die Felgen macht, spielte beim Chef keine Rolle. Vielmehr war es ihm dann wichtig, dass man normal gar nicht dort neben seinem Auto stehen darf, sondern man "spatzieren gehen" sollte :) Und das hat er mit lauter kräftiger Stimme betont! Klar, dann kriegt man ja auch schön gar nix mit, warum es 5-6h dauert um die paar Arbeiten zu machen. Einen solchen Ton dem Kunden gegenüber ist mehr als inakzeptabel! Haltet euch wirklich lieber fern von dieser Werkstatt. Damit macht ihr nichts falsch.

This rag looks cool.  They review all the trendy-ass-kissing bands.  They have a great layout.  And they want so badly to be a mover and a shaker in the community.   

So what's wrong?

They (like a lot of publications) are entirely blinded by the bottom line (rather than readership), which is why you'll NEVER see them be even a little critical of ANY local business no matter how crappy they are.  Everything in this rag is GREAT and GROOVY and COOL.  

All style.  Zero credibility.

I can't believe we get to review a free publication.  Nonetheless, it's important to know (especially for Dave B., who obviously didn't do his research) that this magazine is published by a gentleman who grew up here in the valley and wanted a way to promote all of the great, creative people and activities they are doing by making a free magazine.  He decided this 17 years ago, and, despite pretty much breaking even (it costs money to print and distribute thousands of magazines and no, the ads do not cover the full cost), continues doing so in the name of cultural awareness.  Notice that the photoshoots use local designers, local models, local photographers, and local locations.  The articles are about artwork currently displayed in local galleries, businesses (like restaurants) and bands that local folks have started on their own from meager means, and about up-and-coming events like the taco festival (started by a local), fashion shows (again, utilizing local designers and run by locals - no Dillard's show coverage here) and about people in the valley who are trying to make a difference in our community.  If the magazine doesn't seem critical enough, it's because the people who are the magazine decide what to write about, and therefore don't have to waste pages with hateful criticism when Java can be promoting a local chef or a cool new local jewelry designer.  When it's run by a local, written by locals, and put together in the publisher's dining room, I can't think of any magazine with MORE credibiilty and freedom.  The publisher and writers are meticulous in choosing to write about what moves them rather than what the latest hype is.  That's why you read a story about the man who purchased a building and was designing it into a venue before it was the Crescent Ballroom.  That's also why you'll read the backstory on five locally owned, little-known coffee houses at far ends of the valley.  The candid shots in the back are a tribute to local events the publisher attended but maybe an article hasn't been written about, or to local artists, designers or patrons of the arts.  While it's always interesting to hear what people think of Java, knowing what really goes on behind the scenes gives me nothing but respect for the handful of folks to who put their blood sweat and tears into creating this free publication each month.

Art. Ideas. Taste. Phx Culture. 

I first saw this rag at The Roosevelt and knew immediately I needed to take it home with me. Not only that, I couldn't discard it once I looked through the articles and ads. It's fodder for me, for I often use different magazines and art pieces to jump-start my own creative thinking. 

And since I can do it with this rag, I know Java is cool. 
Plus, within its pages my interest was piqued about events and places around CenPho, including Carly's and Hidden House. 

Could it be better? Sure. Of course. But you can pretty much say that about anything, even well-known mags like Wired, Desert Living, and Phx New Times.

Definitely worth perusing. The apperance may feel "garage produced," but I'd be surprised if you didn't read from front to back and not take away something new or cool.

I've been here long enough to remember when this was an all black and white rag mostly about coffee and art (hence the title 'java').  It seemed quirkier and somewhat more interesting then, but over the years has changed to a glossier fashionista-scenester-hipster mag with the predictable self congratulatory club pix in the back.

Ocassionally there are some interesting articles about architecture, vintage clothes, or area artists, but it's clear that this Java is more about fluff, impressing the scene, keeping it's advertisers, than it is much about substance.  And that is a little sad because it seems like there is potential for a much better mag here, perhaps with better writers and more in depth pieces.

Java is the 944 for the hipsters and wannabe hipsters of Central Phoenix.

Dig it?  Maybe, maybe not.  Depends on the issue, the coverage and how many times I have to see the same DJs, artists, advertisers and the same lanky disheveled stoic Downtowners profiled.

Other times I have found a perfect new gallery to fall in love with or read about the newest wine bar opening up the street.  

Love it or not it this free monthly rag does a better job of covering Central Phoenix, Tempe and other hipster pockets than -- oh wait, zero, zilch, zippo.  

Yes, no one else is covering it.

Normally I don't review Subway's but this time I felt I must. We came here late with a craving for subs. Everything was going okay, me waiting in car until fiance comes out and says please tell me you brought your purse and I said no, we ran out of the house and I brought nothing! Well apparently he forgot his wallet and went back in to tell them that we would have to return. They said it was okay and gave it to us anyway. Now I don't suggest that anyone try anything to get anything for free but it was a very nice gesture. When we came back to the store to pay, they said that's okay! Awesome people work here!

This is probably the best subway I've ever been to. My son and I come here often. Usual drill is I pick him up after school and we grab a bit to eat cuz he's "starving" (teen boy is always hungry). He likes subway and with the $3 sub of the day deal it doesn't kill my pocket. :D
That's not why I prefer this subway. It's the people. They're sweet gals, happy and even though my free cookie coupon is expired they still take it. 

The restroom is clean too!
Great customer service. I've been coming here for years and will continue to come to this subway

Really great Subway. We went in today and we were helped by a young man I think his name was Kory. He greeted us as soon as we we walked in and I ordered the 2.00 Cold Cut Combo , he was very fast and asked me as he went down the line what I wanted. He even told my husband if he wanted a foot long they were on special for 4.00 and he made the sandwich just they way my husband wanted, all while greeting every customer as they walked in the door. I will definately go back again , it was very clean and they even had all the fresh baked cookies

I mostly go to this Subway in Ahwatukee due to the location and proximity to my home.  The staff whom I generally see the same members of, have always been friendly and the service is usually pretty good except when you get those annoying customers who act like they've never eaten a sub before.  

Overall, not too shabby.

Quick service with friendly people. Clean establishment too. As always great subs and salads. My currant favorite here is their breakfast sandwiches! They rock! Especially after a great workout! Love it!

Wrote subway to let them know about this situation. They told me someone would get bck with me...hm....3 months later looks like no one cares! Knew that the moment they didn't tell me they had no bread til I got to the counter to order. Off to competitor!! :)

I LOVE Deer Valley dentistry!  Dr. Spiegel's office staff is very nice and friendly, and the hygienists are amazing! They are so nice and friendly to me and  to my 11 and 8 year old sons. They make dental visits for kids a breeze. Going to the dentist is never a fun chore, but I definitely don't dread any visit to this office!

I have been coming to this dentist office for my entire life... I was raised going to Deer Valley Dentistry and have come to know everyone very well. Dr. Speigal is an amazing dentist and Deb is always friendly and careful when working on me. Whenever I walk through the door, Carmen and Courtney are quick to greet me and they are sure to include everyone in conversation. DVD is a family in itself and warmly welcomes anyone and everyone. They are always joking around and laughing, and never have left me unhappy with my visits. I highly recommend DVD and will continue to bring my business there- I couldn't be happier with my dentist family!!

My experience at Deer Valley Dentistry has been by far the worst! If I was able to give negative stars I would. They wanted me as a new patient and I agreed to come for an appointment at their practice because they promised me that the appointment was paid for by my insurance and promised that there would NOT be any out of pocket expenses to me. Well, the staff at Dr. Jay Spiegel's office simply lied when they said the insurance would cover the appointment, so they could convince me to become their patient. It has been approx. a year since the appointment and I am still getting billed by Dr. Jay Spiegel. The last bill was just under $100. I have asked to talk to Dr. Jay Spiegel himself but have been denied to talk to my own doctor! The receptionist Courtney simply ignors the patient's requests, she says she will take care of the issue but doesn't follow through and doesn't call back. The Office Manager Carmen was extremly unprofessional and laughed at me when I asked to speak to the doctor. Deer Valley Dentistry has put no effort to resolve the issue and continiously sends new bills! Go to another dentist if you want to be taken care of properly.

Been coming here for years!  Doc Spiegal is very warm and friendly, he must have picked his staff in his own age because they are all fantastic!   Carmen is always right there with a great big smile on her face and a genuine welcome on her lips! I use Deb as my hygienist and she is very good with me paying close attention to my very sensitive teeth.  I cannot say enough about this office they are there for you in emergency situations and are empathetic to all your needs and even your financial situation.  Highly recommend!!

Nothing special but if you are hankering for some  falafel, gyros, and shawarma it will hit that spot slightly.  The guy was definitely friendly and they make sure you get what you want. The food looks fresh and it tasted fresh.

What does a shawarma place have without good shawarma?
Nothing.

Alexandria is open late to cater towards the late College Street stumblers but that's where the good things about this place end.
The food is below average. The pitas are soggy, the meat (beef or chicken) isn't very tasty, portions are average and sandwiches aren't cheap. 

Nothing stands out and I always seem to be disappointed after eating here.

Sometimes...after a sweet Black Keys concert, and one too many $14 Air Canada Centre beers... a craving for middle-eastern cuisine will begin to brew.   Now I have to say (being a big shawarma fan)  this place does not offer the best shawarma in the city, but for $5 bucks, at the end of the night, it beats street meat every time... Totally 4 stars!

The restaurant needs to work on its atmosphere and food presentation (you'll know what I mean if you see it) . However the owner is super-duper nice, and this place does offer great value.

Recommendation;
Stick with the shawarma (beef, chicken or felafel), and steer clear of the potatoes.

Sorry Alexandria, you knew what this was, your only beautiful and delicious to me when I've had a few.

Good service, everyone is very friendly, with very generous portions. I ordered the shawarma plate and was extremely full and had a bit of my friend's fish, which was really good. I'll be ordering the fish next time. Everything was fresh.

The setting is nice (wall painting is very beautiful), and the music is relaxing. It's good food for a low price. I'll be coming back

I had the chicken shawarma plate to go - my standard order.
Everything looked really good, the chicken was cut right off the spit, the turnips looked pretty bright and were actual pickled turnip (not dyed cabbage or onion), and the lettuce and tomatoes seemed pretty fresh. The guy at the counter was pretty friendly and generous with the serving (a full square styrofoam take-out container). So I was pretty psyched about this meal, especially after reading the last review.

I started into it and I wanted to like it, I really did! Alas, it was not to be.. The major problem? Everything was too bland!
The chicken was moist and juicy but tasted almost identical to plain Swiss Chalet. Hummus tasted like chickpeas and not much else (not a big problem really). The toum (white sauce) didn't have enough garlic kick. And most disappointingly, the pickled turnips were soggy and soft - not at all crisp - and tasted very watery. The potatoes (might have been some kind of frozen cut up deal) and rice (with lentils) were the tastiest part of the meal. That aint right!

Bottom line: Great appearance, large portion, bland food. I don't see the point of buying chicken shawarma that tastes like plain ol' roast chicken.

This would be a great place if you have a friend with a very sheltered palate who you would like to introduce to falafel and shawarma.

This is a reliable source of somewhat healthy and always tasty food.  The guy who runs this place is SUPER friendly and very generous.  It's mostly shawarma and falafel, freshly made when you order.  The decor is simple but tasteful and new/clean.  I come here about once a week when up up in this area and hungry.  I can fill my belly with all kinds of goodness and for only $9.  AND, it's open super late: 2am most nights and 4am on Fri and Sat.  ATM in the store too.

After an altercation with the hot dog guy down the street we ended up here in need of food during a late night out. 
The chicken shawarma was everything I needed it to be, and although their bathroom was out of order the guy let me come behind the counter to wash my hot sauce dripping hands.
Since there isn't a whole lot of good and fast late night food options in this area, I can't help but suspect to find myself returning in future occasions so this place is a standard 3 star A-OK review.

Store review:
Another county market. I realize they vary in store quality and selection. This is the run of the mill county market. Good inventory, no expired items that I found. This is still not as good as the other location I previously reviewed. Food prices especially for meats are not good, very expensive. I will take my business to the other location.

Pros: friendly staff, well stocked

Cons: expensive

Hidden deals:
1. Sign up for the max card to earn points to get free items. This month was spend 250 to get a 12 pack of pepsi
2. Look for county market mailers for penny pincher coupons

This is not the regular store that my family shops at. We were at the Kirby/Duncan location trying to buy Texas Toast. However, they were completely out. So the Customer Service desk at that location called over to this County Market to see if they had any. They did. However, they failed to mention that they only had one loaf. So we get all the way there and still had to go to another County Market to complete our needs. Overall, County Market is reasonable priced and offers a number of items to fit your needs. Clean store.

My family just moved to the area and in part of our quest to find a good grocery store we tried this county market. It is pretty much the closest store to our house in addition to the Shnucks across the street. Well I did not enjoy my experience at this County Market. The store was very old and seemed dirty. It didn't stock many of the groceries we buy on a regular basis and their were few store brand options. The store also does not live up to the part of its name "Discount Foods". The prices seemed to be just the same as most grocery stores. 

I have been a couple other County Markets and they were much nicer. I really don't have a reason to do our weekly grocery shopping at this County Market ever again.

Can't count on freshness, watch the labels.
Went to get pumpkin bars late in the afternoon and they expire the next day..  Asked if there were any fresher and I was blown off by someone probably just covering the bakery.

 
Used to have the BEST COLESLAW....the Spoon River brand at the deli counter.  Recently, they changed it!!  WHY??  The cabbage is now cut in big pieces and there is less sauce on it.  Very, very disappointed! Asked deli person if they were going to get the cole slaw that was so good, back.  She didnt know.  Went to the customer service counter and she referred me to the deli!  Could someone have called someone that knew??
Was the best cole slaw, and one of the reasons I went to the store.  Now, no reason to go there.

I love the Port of Subs. I fell in love after tasting their smoky cheddar. The cheese is so creamy, a bit sharp and full of flavor. I didn't eat here much before I was a vegetarian, but have been rocking the veggie subs here since that time. 
This location is one of the 2 locations nearest my home. This location is typically clean, but occasionally there are some sketch characters hanging around this location. Maybe its because there is a Wal-Mart next store...and I've seen my fair share of  the People of Wal-Mart website to know they usually have sketch characters shopping there :-P. 
Back to the unfortunately acronym-ed POS...I really enjoy the woman who seems to always be working here (maybe she is the owner??). She is super friendly and does not skip on the veggies. When I order a veggie sandwich, I would assume sandwich shops wouldn't skimp on the veggies, well some do, but not this one. My favorite part of any POS sandwich is the cheese. They have really good cheese. My fave is the smoky cheddar (as previously mentioned, but it  really does deserve another shout out), a close second is the provolone. The cheese here is no exception. Each and every delicious slice is laid out upon the fresh bread to make a little piece of heaven that will soon be enjoyed by my taste buds. Ok, now I am hungry. 

I only have 2 concerns with this Port of Subs. 
1) They close super early (7pm or 8pm depending on if they've had a dinner rush)
2) They do not accept the Port of Subs loyalty card. Ugh! That is no fun at all.

I have never ate at Port of Subs before, so I decided to stop by one day to buy lunch.

I like how they slice their meats and cheese fresh, but damn, they are really stingy with everything inside your sandwich! I went with the medium (8") No. 5, which contained Smoked Ham, Turkey, and Smokey Cheddar Cheese. The cheese especially was sliced VERY thin, I could barely even taste it! I wish the lady who was working could have put more layers of meat in my sandwich as well, to make up for those thin slices. 

Maybe I just happened to come in on a bad day, but there is nothing special about this place. The sandwich tasted okay and got me full, but I can't think of any reason why I would want to come back. I am actually a fan of Jersey Mike's Subs. Same concept - they slice their meats and cheeses fresh. I have not visited a Jersey Mike's here in Vegas yet, but the locations I used to frequent when I lived in California were awesome! They would really load up your sandwich with all the ingredients, it always tasted good, and the employees were friendly! 

I should have spent my $6 across the street at Panda Express or even Krispy Kreme! Ah well, at least I can say that I finally tried Port of Subs.

This is a super close to work so I decided to pop in for lunch. I have never been to a Port of Subs before.

I got a small (5 inch) sandwich that was their limited time/special sandwich-bacon, turkey,provolone and avocado. They have the usual toppings that you can elect to have: lettuce, tomato, red onion. olives, etc. They also have the oil&vinegar, mayo, mustard, salt and pepper and they have dried oregano too. 

I got it as a meal with drink and chips and it was $8 and some change. 

The sandwich had fresh sliced meats, but it's not like it made a significant difference from any other deli sliced sandwich shops. The veggie toppings weren't as fresh. There was no lid on the mayo or mustard and salads (mac, potato and tuna salad) which makes it build a "crust" where it oxidized. Overall sandwich was just okay.

For the price, and especially since Subway is across the street- I don't know how they make business. I was the only one there during prime lunch time with one to-go order. At least at subway I can get a $5 footlong of a sliced turkey sandwich and have half left for later. Same taste but more sauce ,bread, and topping selections there for a better price. Guess where I'm going for my next work lunch sandwich?

Another pleasant surprise on my trip to AZ. I was trying to find a place for lunch and I had some time to kill before catching my plane- so I ended up in a shopping center...I expected Panera (which I really like) but this was so much better! Great selection of sandwiches/soups/salads and friendly service. I wish they'd open up in Chicago!

Great location, but wayyy overpriced! For a Paradise Club Sandwich, small Southwestern Salad, and a cookie it's 18 bucks! And that's not including a drink! Three stars for that reason. Other than that it's always clean and the employees are always nice and welcoming.

This is not specific to this location.  I am finding all Paradise locations are 2-star.  They aren't BAD, but they aren't really great either.  The staff here was friendly enough, and was even calling some customers by name (I assumed they were regulars).  

On this occasion we got bagels, scones and cookies for a meeting.

OK...the scones were really good.  I gotta give them credit.  They were very popular at the meeting.  If it was just the scones they'd probably get four stars.

The bagels were "just bagels", and they didn't offer us any cream cheese (we made the mistake of assuming it was included, so didn't think to ask for any).  The ones at Einstein Brothers are better, and they include the cream cheese (though you do pay a little more for their "baker's dozen", if you buy the cream cheese at Paradise it's about the same).  We ended up getting cream cheese at Einstein because the Paradise was too far away when we realized the error.  They should have asked if we wanted any at Paradise when we were buying the bagels.  Maybe 2.5 stars for the bagels, but deduct a star for neglecting to mention cream cheese.

The cookies taste manufactured.  That's the only way I can express it.  Not like fresh homemade cookies.  Like a machine's interpretation of what a cookie should be.  I am not impressed.  And this isn't the first time.  I think I am done with their cookies.  One star there.

So, overall, that's an average of 2 and 1/6 stars.  Or just 2.
I have not tried anything else except the Chicken Walnut Salad Sandwich (and side), which to me is worth the price.  Cookie that comes with it is really good too!

Always love a good sandwich and soup, but Paradise Bakery clearly disappoints.  We had the half soup/salad and sandwich.   The French Onion Soup was very average, the  chicken on focaccia was  sub-standard, and was surprised that the focaccia bread was underbaked.  I had the Thai Chicken Salad...which to me was a step up from a McDonalds salad and the Pannini (Cuban) was over done.

I have generally had their muffins and baked goods as a take out and they have always been excellent but there are far better places to spend your money on a soup/salad and sandwich.
Feels just like the other Paradise Bakeries I've been to. Nice, clean, food tastes the same.

Stopped in this morning to meet some folks for coffee and it was closed. The lights were off and the sign was off the front. There was no evidence that a Paradise Bakery had ever been there. Unfortunate.

In the grips of a wi-fi withdrawl (while visiting my grandparents in Sun Lakes) I drove through every godless stripmall in the area hoping to find a internet cafe.  I was lured into this wi-fi oasis and have setup my headquarters here.  The tea sucks hard but the cookie aren't bad.  It's a big place that gets really busy around lunch.  5 stars for www dots and for not kicking me out yet.

One of the best run Paradise Bakeries I have been to.  They are generally pretty steady, but usually don't have crazy long lines and poor service like some of the other locations in the area.  They do tend to be really busy for brunch though on Sunday mornings when the weather is nice, so avoid it then.

Tables are usually bussed quickly, and the staff seems to care more and be more helpful.  Shop is pretty clean.

The cookies are delicious!

I hate this Place....Seriously, I can not go here with out a Cookie....
Love The Thai Chicken Salad & Tomato soup, That's my go to meal.
If you love the Club Sandwich, just have them add cranberry, you'll love me later.

This place is awesome.
I go here often. This is my kind of place for a leisurely coffee and roll. Big, open, airy, warm atmosphere. Only downside is it gets too crowded. So find your own place for coffee, this is mine!

Salads are fresh! I recommend ordering from scratch though. However, if you happen to get there at brunch, you'll have to order a salad off their menu because the line isn't ready for personalized orders.

Come here all the time. Never disappointed with the quality of the food, service, and environment. Love the chocolate chip cookies that come with the sandwiches. Always looking forward to each trip to Paradise.
Fantastic place for lunch, food is extremely good...

Every time I come to this place, I promise myself that I'm not going to waste my money here anymore. But it's just so darn convenient to where I work and it has wi-fi so I can do schoolwork over my lunchbreak. 

Pros: Wi-fi. Healthy options. Great cookies. Close to my work (but you don't care about that!) 

Cons: It's way overpriced. When I first moved to AZ I loved this place because the sandwiches were crazy-huge and the salads were overflowing and they had free cookie samples! It could be because I used to visit a different (Central Phoenix) location, but I think that general management has cut portion size by a LOT. My salads don't even come close to filling up the bowl now, much less to overflowing, and you're lucky if your turkey sandwich has as much meat on it as a Subway sandwich. Also, they're constantly messing up my order. And I'm not talking about picky orders, I'm talking about getting mayo when i ask for none, or being charged for a whole sandwich when I ordered a half because they wrote it down wrong (I order the half and half special!) These aren't big deals really but it's annoying when at least half of the time your order isn't right.

I know, I know. I should just stop coming here, right?! But, like I said, it's way too convenient to drive a couple of minutes and get some homework done so I can actually have some free time (what's that?!) in the evenings. 

If I have extra time to drive to the Wildflower at Chandler Mall, believe me, I do.

Paradise is a 3 star in my book.

They have the SAME salads and sandwiches all the time (I occasionally note they change a bit up, but nothing new to add to the repertoire), so if you eat there often (like I used to!), you get bored quickly.

This particular location is decent and clean and fairly quick and friendly and hasn't messed up my orders before, so that's a positive note.

Their nutrition online totally sucks and is always down or 'under construction'.  Also, they are a bit tight with their chicken portions and if you do extra chicken to your salad for added protein, it can add up quickly.  Paying $11 for a salad to me is rediculous.. but that's just me.  If I'm paying that much, it better have LOTS of ingredients and be big and of course have a heaping helping of protein (in the form of meat).

Limited choices of breakfast.   And our orders came in cold. They seemed to run out of people to clean the tables.  My friend added that they always run out of coffee.  I mean, it is definitely not place to start your day but a place for emergency.

I love to come to this restaurant every time I am in rush for lunch. As usual the service crew is giving their out most courtesy which is an A-. I should say it doesn't diminish. Love a roast beef sandwich and their cranberry turkey sandwich. The cookie? hmmm...irresistible. It's a beautiful DAY :)

I used to go to this Paradise often when we lived in Chandler, especially before the "new" one went up on Germann/Gilbert.  But now -- I'm resorted to only visiting 2x a year when I go for my dentist appts near by. :) 

Yes, that's right -- I love Paradise's sandwiches and sweets so much, that even after a dentist visit I'm still picking up some sugar. 

The staff has always been friendly here. And this location has a nice, comfortable feel to it. There even are a few leather sink-in lounge chairs  - - so it's perfect for surfing the internet w/ one of their cookies and some coffee.

As another writer mentioned, we too stopped by this morning to find that this location no longer exists, probably as it has become the new Panera being opened at AZ Ave and Ocotillo, which looks to be soon. Just a surprise to one not tuned in!

The French toast bagel is delicious! Even when I was trying to avoid ordering a pastry or cookie, I decided on this gem instead. It satisfied my sweet tooth! I like to sit here and get some work done after a snack. I did bring my boyfriend a steak panini and he didn't like it. Not sure what he disliked about it, but at least it came with a cookie!

I like to come here for a light breakfast or lunch. I love the soutwest ceasar salad. Also at times, we like to get a few bagels and make sandwiches at home. But dont come past 9am hoping for a bagel that isnt sweet or a good selections of muffins to choose from bc it wont happen. We have tried several times lately, through the week and on the weekend! No choices past 9. And Im not sure what you would order if you went between 10 and 11, they stop serving breakfast at 10, 10 really??? Yep, reallY!

The food is amazing. I love the club sandwich. My husband and I go here for the food and the atmosphere. It is quite homey, I dont like coffee but this would be a perfect place to read the paper and sip a cup of Joe. The cookies are the best if they are cooked right. I find that they do not cook them all the way sometimes. Most of the time I have to get something other than the chocolate chip just because I do not like eating dough.

The workers here are SO friendly. The minute you walk in the door you'll here a "Hello, welcome to paradise!" 
and if you stay to eat/study/chat you'll probably hear it every few seconds.

I love coming here to study. They have lots of chairs and booths that welcome it and the staff, of course, does not care how long you sit. 

Food is decent. There are better bakeries in general but I can say that their cookies and salads are worth trying.

Wife and i visited this PB last night with some coupons we had for dinner. We arrived there around 7pm. The place had very few people in it which was nice.  We sat down in one of the booths next to another booth that was dirty. The place was dead but none of the employees bothered to come out and clean up the whole time we were there. They had music playing over the speakers and every 4 seconds the music would skip like a broken record. This drove me insane. I got up and went over to the counter and asked the girl cutting meat if they could either fix the music or turn it off. She looked at me like i was crazy or something. One of the other employees came up and i explained to him that the music needed to be fixed or turned off. He said the music has been like that for weeks and it didnt bother him. Well it bothers me and i wont come back there until they fix it. I told him to ask the manager for me to turn the music off or fix it. I sat back down and waited for a manager to come acknowledge us but no one ever came. No one bothered to care. From now on i will be going to the other Paradise Bakery off of Germann street and will never come back to this PB. I am finding a lot of the restaurants close to Sun Lakes area suck!

Mmmm - they have a great vegetarian sandwich that I just can't resist!  The bf and I went for lunch on a Sunday and were happily surprised to find that they weren't busy.   The guy taking lunch orders was super friendly, and didn't mind that I'm a picky vegetarian - a big plus in itself!  Always had a positive experience here!
Love to come here for breakfast & coffee. Had a frozen mocha & shared the breakfast burrito. Very good. It's s great place to go & bring your dog to enjoy the patio with you.

I go here all the time...and the fire roasted tomato soup is the most amazing thing ever....and I hate soup.  Go figure.  Anywho, the funny thing that happened today made me realize just how ignorant some of the help could be.  I asked the girl at the counter what comes on the Chicken Artichoke Panini Sandwich and she looked at me strangely and said "chicken and artichokes."  Ok, duh!  Anything else?  Like cheese, tomato, dressing?  "Oh, let me ask."  So she asks the guy that makes the sandwiches what comes on it and he said, "um, I have no idea."  Are you kidding me?  So the manager finally came over and told me everything that was on the sandwich.  Thank you smart lady. 

So, while the service is not the best...the sandwich was amazing.  And I always love my free cookie....
One of my 2nd offices. Never disappointed. Employees happy to help. Incredible food. Free wi-fi :) Free refills. Lots of table choices, Ideal location. It's a winner - go there

So, I've been going to Pardise since it open, what, 7 yrs ago? They have one of the best managers they've ever had, now. Mason, is the best. He's always there when I come in and is the nicest and most helpful manager I've seen EVER. You can tell he's good as all the employere are nice, smiling  and go out of their way to just be pleasant. It's the best feeling to go in here after a hard day at work, so nice!

4 stars? - that's Panera's fault. As they now own Paradise, no samples anmore. Health dept. my foot, that's just Panera being cheap. 

Otherwise, great work, guys - you make it joy to come here!

The food is usually good  and most of the staff are friendly.  Had a bad experience with a counter person there once, she was very rude, if you hate your job, you should quit.  But other than that the low-fat raspberry muffins are my fav.  

**Update:  Went there today and had their new summer salad.  Might as well have gone to mcdonalds for a salad, not great.  Service was better this time.

Ate there yesterday, I love the vegetarian sandwich and the cookies can't be beat.  Only complaint is that the system for getting food and then drinks is confusing and not efficient, too many lines. Just doesn't flow well

While the units are beautiful and spacious, the staff at the leasing/management office effectively eliminates this benefit. In the six months we have lived here we are on our third set of staff. No one knows what the previous one had done or promised so anything we were given or promised by the staff when we moved in was stripped away or forgotten. They care nothing for current residents, have no documentation or note system to track any conversation and have never returned a call. They operate with zero skill set to effectively manage a property. I am a business consultant and I would have fired all of the previous set and the current one. There were two capable people when we moved in but then again, they may have just been nice since they were trying to get us to sign the dotted line. Not worth it folks, big no for me.

Amazing apartments for their price! Nice, quiet and great staff! Mary is very welcoming and a wonderful person.  It's a good secluded area for those who need a bit of a getaway from the city :) but not too far away.

Great complex, just finished a year lease, unfortunately had to move out of town. Yolanda and her staff were extremely helpful, and very easy to work with. Everything was taken care of, maintenance requests completed in a timely mannered. I would recommend Sotelo.

This has been the worst apartment complex I have ever lived in.  Sure from the pictures and at first glance they look beautiful, but once you move in you realize what you see is not what you get. First and foremost, the staff is terrible. Friendly at first until you sign the lease then you will never hear back if you have a question and they back out on promises and statements. They are extremely condescending, lack any form of customer service, and have zero knowledge of property management.  I have never dealt with such asshattery in any of my dealings.   Secondly, the gym is tiny with minimal equipment. Third the apartments are horribly built. Sound echoes thru the halls, walls and ceilings so every step and noise can be heard by your neighbors and vice versa.  Then there is the lack of guest parking that is continually filled with resident cars.  Lastly is the price - WAY to much for what you're getting... There's low income housing across the street, homeless people always lingering, etc. 

Please think twice before choosing this place, it's been such a headache this review can't begin to explain.

I moved here a few months ago and I've had a pretty good time so far.  The management has been very friendly and helpful as are many of the residents that I've met.  I do want to echo the previous review about the egg...it's still there.  There are a few homeless people that walk around, but I've talked to some of them and find their company to be enjoyable actually.  The pool area and other community areas are very nice, and the apartment themselves are wonderful.  There's new appliances, granite countertops, the master bathrooms are way bigger than they need to be, and I love the balconies.  Although I do find the price to be a bit high, I think it's comparable if not better than the alternative apartments in the area.

My only major complaint is that I was promised daily "fresh baked" cookies when I signed the lease.  They took away the cookies a month ago.  I should have written the cookies into the lease agreement.

This place is an absolute nightmare. There are homeless people everywhere, students partying until 3-4 AM 7 nights a week, and the staff is an absolute joke!!! The apartments themselves are decent on the inside, but I would never advise anyone to sign a lease. There are so many better, safer places to stay it makes zero sense to consider Sotelo.

I am living in This stupid Apartment right now.
Very Very Expensive rent. very high but poor services. 
 
Very noisy.. Too much noise from Airport. Air plain fly in and out every 5~10 Min. 
And the noise from Air Plain will make you crazy

Bad Bad service from leasing office. 
People who work there(specially a young female receptionist will treat you like wield stranger, Even she knows you are tenants who lives there). Easy to get ignore by people at leasing office. 

You have to wait at least 10~20 min to speak someone. And always hard to get help.

This is worst apartment I never been.

I moved from Florida to the Sotelo.....I cannot agree with all the negative reviews. The apartments are beautiful and very spacious. The place is immaculate . They remove your garbage daily for you. Maintenance is fantastic.. Even replace light bulbs and a.c filters!!!!!!   Have not experienced any problems with noise on any level. I reside in the Sotelo in a Tempe. .....brand new...gas appliances and fireplace.! Yolanda, Mary and Chris have always been helpful. Negative review people.......if you want to see homeless people ....check out Fort Lauderdale Florida. Person walked up to my car...knocked on my window...offered her a bottle of cold water...she said no I don't like water!!!!!!!!!  1400 square foot apartment is amazing I live in the Jade.

I have lived here for two years.  I leased originally with trillium and we had great management and everything was run clean and efficiently.  Since then the complex has been bought out by grey star and the management staff rotates several times.  The management does not seem to know anything and constantly leaves the office early and or show up late.  They also fail to return phone calls or have any strong follow through.  The apartments themselves are great for the price but with the staff I would never live here again.  The halls are filthy.  We have had a cracked egg that ia in the stair well for over a month that I have reported to be cleaned up and it still has hardly been touched.  There are also so many homeless people who stand outside of the gates at night it makes it feel unsafe since the new management has cut the amount of security to save money.  If you are looking for a nice place to live in the area there is always W6 and few nice condos for the same rent price.  This is the last place I would pay upwards of 1500 dollars a month to live.

Sotelo is a fine complex as far as nice apartments go, but the management and other residents are horrible. Yolanda Moreno is the absolute worst property manager I have ever seen in my life. She is extremely unintelligent and rude.She never has an an answer for any questions I have and never actually does what she says she is going to do. I despise having to deal with her, but because the management is so bad I have to. The staff has been switched at least four times in the past 6 months and I cannot keep track of all the morons that pretend to work here. If Greystar owned the property when I was first looking to move in here I definitely would not have chosen to live here. Every member of the Greystar team is idiotic and disgusting and no one talks to each other or gets anything done. I have asked them multiple times to complete a maintenance request and they never did it. It took me going in the third time and practically spelling out the order for them before it was performed. The online payment system is always an issue and they take no responsibility for it. They come in late and leave early and never answer the phone. The rating reviews on the actual website are inaccurate, and the community amenities are a lie.   We keep a very clean apartment, but came back after summer break and had rats. As noted, there is no free professional service pest control, once again another lie. 
The residents are rude and dirty and loud. You can hear absolutely everything through the walls and annoying dogs wake you up at 6 in the morning. The pool is small and dirty and people blast music and scream at all hours of the night with no repercussions. The stairways and hallways always smell like weed and have bugs and eggs in them. There are homeless people wandering around the complex and the housing across the street is run down and crappy, only drawing in more filthy people. There used to be a security team that patrolled the complex at night but I have not seen them in months.
You do get assigned parking below the buildings, which is nice, however if someone parks in your space there is nothing you can do about it and the management will do nothing for you, so you are out of luck. 

Save yourself money and dignity and DO NOT LIVE HERE!
Not great but not terrible. Big units that offer very spacious layouts, however the abundance of asu students makes living in the area stressful
Super cool bartenders. Dangerously cheap drinks. What more is there to say?

I went one Friday night right after work and met my wife for a (meaning "one") drink.  It was happy hour and the free hotdogs were there for the eatin'-yum!  WELL, we ordered two bacardi and gingers and the bar tender gave us the drinks and said $4.50 please.  I said, we ordered TWO-why so cheap is it happy hour? She said, nope-"we are always happy here" but that was their REGULAR price. $2.25 for a call drink AND free hotdogs (when i was there) --my kind of place!! We ended up staying for a few hours!! It is attached to the Decatur Drug store which has one of the last drugstore diners in Vegas!
I heard the bar is under a new owner, but it doesn't sound like it changed any! www.decaturliquor.com note- you can buy booze to go also!

Unexpected treasure. People refer to it as Decatur Tavern,  but that's not what's on the sign so I was confused at first. I didn't know this place was a proper bar, looks like just a package store, but it's so much more. Inside it has a strange mid-Western bar feel. No frills, just everything you need to have a good time.  Plenty of seating, a pool table and really cheap drinks. 

Thursday night there was karaoke with Wes and Patti... long rotation but lots of fun song selections and a really good fun-loving vibe... somewhat older crowd with little b.s. There was some drama between two guys but everyone handled their business and it doesn't get stupid. 

I saw a kitchen but we didn't have any food so I can't comment on quality or hours. 

I think this place is a great locals gem... good vibe, easy on the wallet, close to the Highway and good place to meet up with friends.

Super strong drinks for super cheap. They have great specials, and it seems they always have a holiday celebration of some sort. 
The bar is incredibly large too. Wasn't too smokey when I was there, but it was mid afternoon. 

When I'm, in the area this would be a place to stop again for sure!
Ordered a long espresso to go, it didn't cost much and didn't take long to get it. Staff was friendly. Espresso was very good. Would come back if I ever find myself in this part of town again.

This is my favourite STARBUCKS in Montreal, for the simple reason, I love the staff here, I used to do some of my freelance work here, and I got to know the staff. People can make a place so much better and that's exactly why I would give this place 5 stars.

I am just in love with Starbucks and have never had a coffee or skinny vanilla latte that did not taste perfect
Thank you Starbucks for making my mornings and those extra last minute needed lattes or coffees later in the day!
To much marketing costs for a simple coffee. Nice ambience. Nice Logo. Common coffee.

This is a decent Starbucks. Not the best, in terms of ambiance, but definitely nowhere near the worst.

It's on a corner of a busy street, just down the hill from the cathedral. The cafe itself is pretty small - probably half a dozen tables or so on the inside. It was busy when we were there, but not full. I saw several students with laptops. There were also half a dozen tables with umbrellas outside, which was very nice, but it wasn't the greatest patio space ever, because it was on a busy corner that had plenty of cars and people going by, but not much atmosphere (the cafe across the street, with a much more spacious terrace and a fountain, seemed to be where all the atmosphere was at).

However, my sister and I were dying for some refreshing iced coffees, something that was harder to find in Montreal than I expected. From my trip there, I noticed a lot more Parisian-style cafes and bistros, as opposed to American-style coffee shops. And sometimes, you just want to grab a cold coffee from the counter and sit outside with it.

The girl who took my order was super friendly, in a nice way. I had a free drink coupon, which I was happy to find I could use in Canada.

There were two bathrooms at the back that were in good condition, as well.

I had some trouble with the free wifi. I had my iPhone with me (AT&T data turned off), and when I tried to connect to the free Bell wifi, I kept receiving error messages in Safari instead of landing pages. Other people had their computers and phones, so if I'd inquired, I might have been able to get some help, but I wasn't that interested in using it, so I didn't bother. I was intrigued by the issue, though.

Came here for the first time today with a friend to try their bulletproof coffee after someone recommended it. It's a special type of coffee that's more beneficial than regular coffee (I haven't read too much about it but there's tons of stuff written about it on the interwebs). My barista blended it with a bit of butter and maple syrup to cut the bitterness and the tart taste of the butter. I had it hot and my friend had it iced; I definitely recommend it hot. Oh man, that was probably some of the best coffee I've ever had. It's pretty expensive at $5 for a cup of just coffee (no tax) but that's pretty good considering the quality of the coffee compared to all the sugared up mixed coffee drinks these days. I'd take a cup of this stuff over that junk any day. One of the best things about the bulletproof coffee is that it's not supposed to give you the jitters and anxious side effects like regular coffee, which I hate when I choose coffee for a perk. And it was true, I didn't experience any of the usual anxiety when I drink coffee. Apparently, some people use this coffee as a meal replacement in the morning to get a boost on fat loss...I'll probably stick to drinking it for the taste and the brain boost. Our barista was super nice and explained all this to us and what was in it and how it's made. She was great! 

I haven't tried the cross fit facilities (I'm very happily committed to Brass Vixens) but I hear great things and how religious people are about their work out...Who knows, I may try it in the future if I ever want to change things up. My friend and I liked sitting in the space and played a game of Connect Four with our coffee before heading on our way. The huge space is also used to sell running shoes, work out gear, and healthy snacks and food (lots of paleo stuff). I'll definitely be back to get another cup of this awesome coffee. Thumbs up!

I love when crossfit boxes have a tshirt drop in deal! Buying an item of merchandise will cover your drop in at Academy of Lions  which is awesome but I wished they had more sizes available when I dropped in a few weeks ago. I mean..is a Mens Medium that hard to stock? this place is really cool though as they have a whole paleo cafe set up and two floors of crossfit awesomeness. Will definitely be back.

This was one of several boxes I checked out in T.O, while the WOD was enjoyable (as always) I felt that perhaps the trainers could've done a better job watching people's form, movement instruction etc. As a new CF-er I felt that had I not gone with my exerienced CF partner, I could have been at risk to hurt myself. I saw many members rushing the WOD and lifting heavier than necessary with poor form (the WOD was deadlifts/pushups 20 min AMRAP). The overall environment wasn't really welcoming, which could just be me looking for a more 'friendly' box. It sstill appears to be a quality box, just one that could use a little more care in what they do.

Academy of Lions is an amazing CrossFit Gym.  It is incredibly diverse, interesting and intellegent in its classes as well as its programming.  They offer CrossFit WOD classes, gymnastics, olympic lifting, mobility yoga, pose running technique workshops and more.  It is truly a great place to train.  The coaches are all very knowledgeable and Alex Varbanov heads up the olympic lifting classes so technique and correct form is always stressed at the academy.  It does not disappoint. I would urge anyone to give this place a try if you are considering CrossFit.  I have been there for 5 months now and have seen phenomenal results. I love this place!

Best coffee in Toronto!!  $5 for the butter coffee -  can't be beat . This place is super cool. In the summer the doors are wide open and you can get everything from clothing to coffee. Every time I am in this part of town, I will always stop in and grab a cup butter coffee! It cannot be beat. Seriously.

They make you do 3 fundamentals classes before you can participate, except they are only 3 days a week and so it can be hard to make it if you work later than 5pm, like I do. 

I bought a $200 pack of 10 classes and they always gave me a hard time when I dropped in because I didn't do the 'fundamentals' class - but they gladly took my money. 

Instead, encouraged me to use the upstairs gym by myself, and so when I came back to do so, a different manager told me that I wasn't allowed to because I didn't finish the Fundamentals. I told them that I dropped $200 and I can't even use their gym? She didn't seem to care and refused entry to me. 

Never going back. Over-priced and self-righteous.

If you can work out weekdays at 10 am in the Dundas / Ossington area, I'd highly recommend Academy of Lions.

What they offer at this time, Monday to Friday, is an Agatsu Kettlebell class, a high-intensity combination of cardio and strength activity done in a small group.
