When I first came here I thought of subway, but more clean, military discount, and more friendly. They took me through the whole process and everything they had to offer without asking. I must say when I got home I had some more questioned so I called them and they told me that I could and should cook the pizza on the plate that it had come on. They was not upset or rushed me off the phone, nothing calm polite and even offered for me to call them when I have eaten to tell them how was my first pizza. From that day forward I come here and I recommend papa to everyone. All that needs left from this place is delivery

I love this place. It's quick and easy, can sit there and basically build the pizza yourself. Glad to have one so close. The owner is usually there and the staff are always clean and polite. Almost all the pizzas are under  10 bucks and they give a lot of coupons. 

The pizza itself is pretty damn good. I like the thin crust and the regular. Never tried the stuffed because ya usually just me. The side are pretty good as well.

Thin crust, deep dish, regular crust...Papa Murphy's gets down!! This is such a beautifully simple idea that his the nail on the head! TAKE'N'BAKE pizza is the shizz and Papa Murphy's is definitely the best I've had in AZ anytime recently. 

VERY inexpensive and always reliable. Easy to feed a whole squad for a little cash and its honestly good pizza. If you don't like it, check yo mouf!!
I've always been a big fan of Papa Murphys and this is a great location. Food is always well prepared and fresh.

Thrilled to see a Papa Murphy's closer to ASU! 

Custom pizzas and salad for a great price! Loved that the salads are made to order instead of sitting on ice. 

Cowboy is my favorite if you aren't sure what to try!
Try the thai chicken pizza - we crave it now! Add pineapple!

This is my favorite Japanese restaurant!  My Sweet portion of Friday routin.  The restaurant that had the best fish quality in Vaughan. My favorite dish is  assorted sashimi Don.  Quality is good compare to the price.

This is one of our regular spots to get take out from. Their fish is always fresh! The selection is good. I especially love the rolls without rice. 
The staff is so friendly and the chef; if you get a chance have a chat. He's a great man :) ex-military who's traveled lots and knows a lot about fish hehe, where to get the best and so on...

Went: 7:30 pm Thu May 21 2015 (6th couple date)
Ordered: 12 pieces sashimi platter and eel roll
Cost: incl. tax and tip $25-30
My gf's input: It's quiet and cozy.  The servers are very attentive. The shashimi is fresh. The eel roll is perfect. The layers of rice, avocado, and eel is just right.
This was our first ever middle of the week date, though we were together with a group of friends on New Year's Day. We went to a restaurant near her house. I was addicted and needed to see my girl more and more.
Bottom line: I would definitely come back. Good sushi does not really taste that different from other places that do it well. This is one of the better sushi restaurants.

Price is comparable to any other sushi restaurant. Went for lunch on Saturday, not busy (but that could be weather wasn't the greatest after hurricane Sandy), waitress was very polite and attentative, Ordered small Sushi boat, and food was excellent and fresh, and chilled just right so you they've chilled it to kill any harmful bacteria. Sushi didn't have excessive rice, except on the nigiri. Sashimi was also cut  with good width, not overly  thick and not too thin.They served us a free hand roll, salad and miso soup, even though it doesn't come with the boat. Dessert was fresh orange and hand cut green apple designed to look like a swan or bird. Very thoughtful and skillfully done.

For food I would give them a 3, for service I would give them a 4..
The lady working here was very nice.

I went for lunch with a friend and my boyfriend.
They have lunch specials here for about $14 with tax.
There are cute booths, but the place wasn't very busy.
I ordered a lunch special that came with 8 spicy salmon and 8 spicy tuna.
There was a sweetness to the sauce that I wasn't particularly fond of.
I was still hungry after, but because of my limited time I didn't order anything else.
I tried my boyfriend's philidelphia roll. It was big and tasted good but I wasn't the biggest fan of the rice.

We were given a cute cut up orange for dessert.

If other sushi restaurants hadn't popped up in the area, I would visit this one a lot more.
That being said, it wasn't my favourite, but I'm glad I tried it.
Food was fresh, tasted great and was well presented. Very cozy and clean environment, and very friendly service. Also, I like the privacy of the booths. :)

Wir waren mit Freunden zum Abendessen an einem Samstag Abend hier.
Das Lokal ist stilvoll eingerichtet. Die Bedienung aufmerksam und freundlich.
Da wir sehr früh reserviert hatten (18 Uhr) war das Lokal noch ziemlich leer jedoch waren alle Tische reserviert. 
Eine Reservierung ist deshalb dringend empfohlen. 
Wir bestellten verschiedene Gerichte von der Karte, Vorspeisen, Hauptgänge, Desserts und dazu passende Weine.
Leider erhielt eine Person das falsche Hauptgericht, welches die Bedienung mit einem Espresso oder Digestif wieder gutzumachen versuchte. Die Gerichte waren durchweg ausgezeichnet. 
Das Lokal füllte sich zusehends und dementsprechend nahm leider die Aufmerksamkeit der Bedienung immer weiter ab. Nachdem wir ca. eine halbe Stunde mit leeren Gläsern zugebracht hatten, entschieden wir uns zu zahlen. 
Unsere Jacken, die uns anfangs abgenommen wurden, haben wir uns dann selbst geholt. 

Alles in allem ein tolles Lokal, welches man uneingeschränkt empfehlen kann.
Nicht ganz günstig aber allemal das Geld wert.

Ostersonntag waren wir zu viert unter anderem 
aufgrund eines Artikels in der EZ über die Neueröffnung des Goldenen 
Ochsens in eben jenem welchen. Klar 
waren die Maßstäbe hoch angesetzt, wurde doch eine kreative Küche, 
vegetarische Gerichte und Gourmetcharakter angeprießen. Wir kamen an
  der Parkplatz könnte einladender sein, aber ok, wurden zum Tisch 
geführt. Wir bekamen Brot+Salz+Butter als Einstiegsknabberei, die 
dann auch bis kurz vor dem Abschlusskaffee auf dem Tisch stand. 
So, ich 
als Vegetarier war auf das Schlimmste vorbereitet, wobei ich ja doch 
einen Hoffnungsschimmer hatte, da ja explizit die vegetarischen Gerichte
 vorab betont wurden. Tja, in der Karte habe ich diese nicht gefunden. 
Es gab genau EIN vegetarisches Hauptgericht, das sich nicht gerade durch
 Kreativität auszeichnete: Fettuccine in Buttersauce mit Trüffel. Gut, 
nach einer Alternative gefragtmusste der Kellner in der Küche 
nachfragen und dann hieß es da ist leider nicht viel anderes möglich, 
man könnte höchstens ein mediterranes Gemüse dazu machen. Erstmal 
Getränke bestellt, was übrigens an dem Abend das einzige Mal war, bei 
dem die Kellner uns nach Getränken gefragt haben. 
Essen kam, gegessen, 
Essen war ansich gut, wenn auch (sagten 3 von 4 Personen) etwas fade. 
Aber das ist ja Geschmackssache. Das Essen war wie gesagt gut, aber 
hyperkreativ und außergewöhnlich war es nicht. (Gourmet mit Schwabennote
  da könnte man so tolle Sachen machen!!! Das Schwäbische kam, wenn ich
 mich nicht täusche, aber gerade mal in einem Hauptgericht und einer 
Vorspeise vor!) 
Dessert bestellt (1 von den nur 3 vorhandenen Desserts 
war aus  gut, am Ostersonntag könnte man das vlt noch verzeihen) sowie 
Kaffee. Der Kaffee kam sofort, 10 Minuten später sogar nochmalwie 
generell an dem Abend wirkte der Service etwas unbeholfen und 
unkoordiniert, wenn auch bemüht. Beim Bezahlen gab es Probleme mit dem 
Kartengerät, wo sich dann auch zwei verschiedene Servicekräfte drum 
kümmerten, wodurch es wieder zu doppelten Nachfragen kam. Mäntel durfte 
man sich dann auch selbst holen.
 Zum Ambiente: Ansisch schön, aber 
von den schönen goldenen Deckenlampenbehängen bekommt man so im Sitzen 
eben leider nicht viel mit. Die Blumendeko im gesamten Raum bestand aus 
zu vielen verschiedenen Sorten Blumen, dadurch wirkte es nicht mehr so 
stilvoll. Uralt aussehende Rolladengurte waren jetzt nicht so schlimm, 
aber kleine Details, die eben in einem gehobenem Restaurant doch 
auffallen.

Fazit: Wir werden nicht mehr hingehen.
Das Fachgeschäft für Weine aus der Region Baden Wuertenberg . Das Angebot ist gross die Auswahl riesig und für jeden Geschmack und Geldbeutel etwas dabei.

Die Fellbacher Weingärtner verkaufen im Weingut Ihre Produkte. Die Fellbacher Weine finde ich ausgesprochen gut, da sie weit weg von dem verstaubten Klischee des Württemberger Weinmännchen sind. Innovative Qualitätsweine stehen hier im Vordergrund. Man kann sehr gute themenbezogene Weinproben buchen, z.B. Wein & Schokolade oder man hat die Möglichkeit auch mal eine individuelle Weinprobe arrangiert zu bekommen.
Die Beratungen zu den Weinen sind ausgesprochen nett und umfangreich.
Ein Besuch lohnt auf alle Fälle!

I recently took about 20 pieces of heirloom jewelry and my wedding ring to Diny's to have appraised. Most of the jewelry was appraised in 2009 (another state) as part of a family estate and a few were given to us by one of other mothers. Before selecting Diny's I first did a lot of online research about what credentials to look for when seeking an appraisal. Of all the jewelers in the Madison area, Pete Diny is the only one who is both a Graduate Gemologist (GIA) and a Master Graduate Gemologist Appraiser (IJO). I needed someone who was knowledgable of old jade, vintage watches and pearls. When first interviewing Pete I said that I had a lot of old jewelry but I didn't know if the pieces were costume or real. He said to bring everything in and he would be happy to look through what I had. I set up an appointment. We had agreed that he would only do a formal appraisal on jewelry that he thought would come in with an insurance value over $1000. He looked at all the pieces I brought in, separating out the costume jewelry and the pieces above and below the minimum. He was very pleasant to work with, respectful of the pieces and extremely familiar with older jewelry and took pictures of the pieces to be appraised. I could tell right away that he really enjoys looking at and appraising estate jewelry. I was given a copy of the picture of the collection he would appraise to take with me. I brought the pieces in on a MOnday and the appraisals were ready before Friday. I knew that I could have paid a lot less to have the jewelry appraised somewhere else. I had some appraised at another long time jeweler a few years ago but the appraisals came back with no reference images on the write up. Each Diny's appraisal includes a picture of item - which I appreciated as some of my jewelry is very similar in appearance. Diny's also offers a lifetime appraisal so I can bring in a piece anytime to have it reappraised. Great. Because the value of gold has increased 4x from 2009, I was pleasantly surprised that the value of the pieces appraised in 2009 increased at least 4x. On MOnday I contacted my insurance company to increase the insurance value of my wedding ring since I enjoy wearing it. Having the lifetime appraisal policy is well worth the cost of the appraisals. I felt confident that I received a professional appraisal and that my jewelry was in good hands at all times. I would highly recommend Diny's Jewelers.

Our first encounter with Diny's was at a bridal show this past January, about a week after our engagement. Diny's was the only jewelry stand we stopped at that day. I have a very unusual engagement ring; it's an antique ring that was given to me after my grandmother's passing and has a scalloped edge that is difficult to match a band to. They showed us a few rings and one in particular stood out. We also looked at men's rings and took down the numbers for both rings. Last month, after looking only online at other rings, no other ring stood out like the ones we saw at Diny's stand. We decided to go and check it out at the store one more time. Nick Diny helped us out that day and we also realized he was the one from the bridal show that showed us the rings originally. Those were the only rings we looked at, and they were the rings we ended up buying. 
 
Because I have never had my grandmother's ring appraised and knew nothing about it, I asked Nick if he could take a look at it and tell me anything about it. He noticed right away that one of the prongs holding on to the largest diamond was damaged and warned me that I probably shouldn't be wearing the ring in that condition, something I would have never known on my own. Upon closer inspection, he also noticed that there was some engraved detail work that had been worn down over the years and stated that they could restore it to it's original 1940's look. Another detail I would not have known had I not had him look at it. It took a few weeks, but when it came back it was amazing!! It was already a fabulous ring and I was not sure how it could look better, but it looks absolutely beautiful! It's like a whole new ring! I actually cried on the ride home from picking it up because I already loved my ring, but now I love it even more. 
 
The whole experience was wonderful. We didn't feel pressured and it was very comfortable. It took a lot of trust to give up my grandmother's ring, but I never once felt worried. It took a week longer than expected because they were not 100% happy with some of the detail work and wanted it perfect. That attention to detail was very much appreciated, especially with something that holds such great sentimental value to me. I highly recommend Diny's and can guarantee that we will be back in the future!

My fiance searched for months for the right wedding band: style, budget, fit. Found the perfect ring at Diny's. Nick was very helpful and a breath of fresh air after talking to many other jewelers in the area. The result was a custom ring with a Tamil font engraving that didn't break the bank. Thank you! Made a customer for life.

First of all this is a fantastic space with stellar products. The owners both have successful small businesses in the area and shopping here only puts money back into the city. 
It's a win-win.
Secondly they have their own clothing line created here by locals as well. Nothing beats Clevelanders supporting creative Clevelanders and that is exactly what you are doing when you buy their clothing.
Lastly everything is quality, the service is kind and friendly and the location is outstanding. 
It's about time I don't have to go to a chain like Nordstrom or Saks to get some higher end clothing in this city!

What a terrific boutique right in downtown Cleveland!  Dredger's Union carries menswear, womenswear, and gifts/small home accessories.  They design and make many of their own items right in Cleveland, and the space itself is beautiful and spacious.  The displays are well-thought-out and invite browsing, and the staff is wonderfully friendly and gracious.

The clothing has a wonderful vintage American vibe, with sophistication.  This is basically the store that places like Madewell are TRYING to be.  

Don't miss the tees with vintage woodblock prints, the Dredger's Union brand button-downs, and the charming jewelry selection! Also, make sure you sign up for their email list!

I am so excited that retail has started to come back to downtown. Dredger's Union is a great store - similar to Anthropologie, though a little less frilly & of course, there is a large men's department. The prices are very reasonable for the most part (and definitely lower than Anthro). Most of the women's clothing is around $60 to $100. The men's clothing, much of which is made in USA, is also priced surprisingly low.

The store itself is beautiful and a joy to shop. It's well organized and thus a very relaxing experience.

As for any complaints about parking - I ride my bike. And if you can't do that, take the rapid or pay a few dollars to park. Paying to park is commonplace for any downtown metro. Not every part of the city can have acres of parking lots that are rarely more than a quarter full (and thank goodness for that).

Yes, Cleveland!  I love local boutiques, especially those that show their Cleveland Pride! This store does - with their own clothing line, and jewelry/accessories from local artists - it's stellar! 

This is a great spot to find adorable unique dresses, jackets, oxfords, bags, jewelry, kitchen accessories, baby clothing/gifts, home decor fun - and more! 

My favorite thing that they have is an East 4th History book.  It's amazing, and tells you about the history of the street, and how it became to be how it is today.  Lots of fun facts in there!

This is a store Cleveland can be proud of.  The clothing is of such high quality using quality materials such as silk and wool - all made in the U.S. much of it in Cleveland itself!  I was very impressed with the styling and the use of materials.  Prices are high but quality usually is.

Yeah this is another great place in DT CLE.  What a gem. Lots of high quality clothing.  Loved the basement.  I'm not very much into brand clothing but did notice they have FCUK which I can not find in the CLE. Great customer service. I even found a nice jacket which I took home. Thanks Heidi! BTW do not expect Target type of pricing.   This is more of a  boutique I guess.

Dredgers Union, you make me wish I was a wealthy girl. If only the clothes were cheaper, I'd buy the ENTIRE store! 

The clothes here are so unique, so modern, and SO fashionable. I love this place and I wish I could meet the designer.

The room is awesome. All the local Cleveland art just really makes me feel cozy and awesome. I'm not born or raised in Cleveland but I always admire chefs and artists who truly love and aspire to enrich Cleveland. So, thank you Dredgers Union for doing that.

This new boutique is definitely worth a visit. You can't mistake the Anthropologie vibe and similar sorts of merchandise: high quality clothes, perfume, candles, books, dresser knobs, jewelry, curtains, baby stuff...you get it. One downside of the location is it's nearly impossible to avoid paying to park. Also, from what I saw, these are definitely Anthropologie prices. Some items were reasonable but some gave me sticker shock: $35 for a newborn baby t-shirt, $75 for a keychain charm, $18 for a 4 oz candle. This place is exactly what the young, hip, locally-minded Clevelanders are looking for.

This is a gorgeous store that has been expertly curated. Cleveland needs more just like it.  The menswear is fantastic, especially the selection of shirts and sweaters.  Don't get me started on the hats.

I wish the store the success it deserves.

I love this store! I have gone to several embroidery stores in Vegas and they have always ruined my scrubs and lab coats. I brought my scrubs here and they came out so good I brought in 10 more pairs! Kevin and Liz are super friendly and always willing to help their customers.

Had some work done here in the past which tbh was quite expensive but they didn't do me wrong so I tried giving them more work. After calling and following up THREE times I just gave up. This company is nonresponsive.

I bought an amazing TaylorMade golf bag for someone as a Christmas present and figured I would get his name embroidered on it. This embroidery was supposed to be the amazing finishing touch to the present but instead, Embroid Me ruined it.

If you know anything about golf, you would know that the names on golf bags are always in CAPS. For example: JOHN SMITH, not John Smith. I brought the detachable pocket from the $180.00 golf bag into Embroid Me and picked out a font and paid $25.00. I was so thrilled to go in this afternoon to pick up the embroidered pocket and what does it say?? John Smith, not JOHN SMITH.

It's a good thing I know a few things about golf, so I wasn't completely fooled by what Kevin at Embroid Me had to say. I was advised that only company names are in all caps...individual golfer names are usually in regular print as to not scream out the name. Completely incorrect. Check the guys on tour...their names are all in CAPS.

Kevin, who seems like the manager, suggested that I bring him another pocket so he could embroider it for me right away. Great solution if the pocket didn't require me buying another golf bag for $180.00. I am still trying to see if I can purchase another pocket from TaylorMade individually. If not, I will have to gift the golf bag as is. 

Long story short...if they're in the embroidery business and advertise themselves as being able to customize golf bags, then do it correctly. Don't try to brush customers off with BS explanations about why their embroidery came out incorrectly.

This place doesn't give you any sort of receipt or carbon copy to show your order. Kevin also admitted that he assumed regular letters when taking my order, not all caps (although he should've known!?). Make sure you specify every little detail because apparently they know nothing and will just assume instead of asking the customer.

So much for a finishing touch. This was the first & also last time I will be going to this place.

I called them on the phone to get information on potentially doing some embroidery work for a one-off birthday gift for my dad.  The man who answed the phone politely informed me that they do not do retail, one-offs anymore and focus on b2b.  However, he took time to direct me to other embroydery options that would be more of a suit for my needs.  I really appreciate it when businesses do this, which is why I want to leave them a good review.

LOVE this store! The only embroider-er I will go to in Las Vegas!

I've tried a few embroidery shops in Las Vegas, and most of the time I've experienced slow turn around and an unwillingness for custom requests. This embroidery shop is amazing. The owner is super nice and all the employees are very service-oriented and they deliver a GREAT product. They have delivered my items days ahead of schedule also. Their price is very fair. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

I have been going to this store for over 6 years. They are fast, friendly, and always do a great job. I send all of my clients there. If I ever have a concern, they handle it right away! Kevin & Liz are fantastic!

It's a shame the former shop and owner were always someone and somewhere I could bring my pet. I am not sure if they sold their shop or just closed but I will be looking for a new groomer. This new owner is sub standard and does not deliver what is promised, my dog was still dirty and cut shorter than I had asked for.

I love Grooming on Broadway! I take my dogs there and only there. She does my pomeranian beautifully. My other dog is fairly low maintanence and so she does his nails and bathes him.  Stephanie really knows her stuff.  She's really excellent at grooming dogs before the dog shows. She's also the only one that can cut my daughters'pug's nails quickly and painlessly. Would highly recommend. (Price is right too)

I like the new owner and staff.  My dog is benefiting from their washes[they double wash], more importantly my dog comes home not running under the bed!  My dog was groomed as I asked when they cut her.

Izumi ist das einzige japanische Lebensmittelladen in Stuttgart.
Obwohl der Preis doppelt oder dreifach so hoch wie in Düsseldorf ist, bin ich dankbar, dass es überhaupt noch so ein Laden in Stuttgart gibt. Zu Notfall bekommt man dort komplette Zutaten und Saucen für z.B. Yakisoba, Okonimiyaki, Akaimiso, Ozukemono usw.
Das bese Qualitätsmerkmal ist sicherlich, dass auch Japaner hier einkaufen, bietet ein japanisches Queerbeetangebot mit gutem Service!
Bestimmt der einziger Geschäft in Stuttgart mit Japan Waren. Gut, dass es so was gibt. Habe aber mehr erwartet. Das es größer ist mit ausreichend Auswahl.

Das Izumi ist etwas versteckt im Lehenviertel gelegen. Auch wenn der Laden von aussen eher klein aussieht, bietet er doch viel was das Herz eines Japanfreunds erfreut (ausser Mangas, getragenen Slips und solchen Sachen :-).
Wer es nicht bis in das Lehenviertel schafft, kann auch online über die Webseite bestellen.

A great spot to stock up on all your Japanese essentials. A small grocery with everything from Japanese beer and saki to wet udon noodles to frozen dumplings. Also a selection of miscellaneous Japanese merchandise. 

They don't speak any English but they worked with me in broken German to order a case of OWA beer!

Got a ton of cases of wine here, and I have to say that I am a fan of this place! We got a couple of different types of wine that are just in the basement. I love cooking with red and white wines, so I love having bottles available for when I want to make some nice french dishes. Also, the wine is pretty good. I mean it won't compete with your $100 bottle from the LCBO, but for a decent price if you just want a quick drink, it is pretty good. Definitely exceeded my expectations. Once I run out, I will definitely be back for a few more orders. They have a wide selection of different wines. Making the wine and bottling was fun. They show you and let you do it yourself.
If you have never made your own wine, then you should do it now. You won't regret it.

I had such a great experience making wine at Sheppard Wine Works.  The entire experience was fun, educational, and most importantly, I got 30 bottles of wine out of it for $150 (using a Groupon).  That's $5 per bottle!  And it's really drinkable stuff!!

The wine we made was a 6-week Malbec. We chose it, even though it cost slightly more, because the owner (I assume) Russ was super nice and let us try a few samples and we liked that one the best.  He was really fair about letting us try things in the entire price range and was never pushy about up-selling us on the more expensive stuff, we chose it entirely on our own.  I think it tastes as good as most wines in the $10-$15 range at LCBO, which is what I usually drink.

We also have picked up DIY 2L beer kits ($6) from here in the past, which I also highly recommend.  So simple, just drop a vial of yeast into the bottle, leave it on your kitchen counter, and in 7-10 days, BEER!

We already have our next batch of wine picked out so I can't wait to go get it made.

First, ignore the positive reviews and "we have been faithfully serving...since 1996" and "...for the past two years we have been voted the Reader's Choice Award for the Best of the Best". The place is under a (relatively - about a year or less) new owner (Russ). Second, ignore the "Your satisfaction is our guarantee" and " If you are not happy with your wine, we will gladly replace the wine for you" statements on their website because they are simply not true. After making wine - a LOT of wine - at a variety of Toronto establishments over the past 15 years I finally had a bad batch. One of the two I made at Sheppard was undrinkable - it had a heavy metallic taste (although my wife said it tasted like the 'sweet tarts' candy). I called Russ and brought it back. His offer was to give me half price on my next batch. When I pointed out the "your satisfaction is our guarantee" line he (a) told me half off my next batch was the best he could do because he "wouldn't be making any money"  (b) accused me of trying to "rip him off" and (c) said the flaw was due to dirty bottles with mold in them. When I asked him to point out the mold he said it couldn't be seen because it was microscopic. At no time did he taste or test the wine (although he said before coming in that he would do so). There are so many reputable winemaking places in Toronto with knowledgeable owners who care about customer satisfaction you really have no excuse for going to Sheppard.

How often do you go to a mechanic or the dealership to get your car worked on and come away feeling like you know a guy and gal that just hooked you up?  Well that's how I felt leaving Parts Score today.  Jason and Leah run a business the way a business should be run.  They provide quality workmanship, at a great price, with EXCELLENT customer service.  

Stop taking your BMW to the dealership or rolling the dice with some sketchy mechanic.  Go to these guys knowing you can trust them to take care of your car the way you want.  Just go, don't think about it, do it... you'll be glad you did.

What can I say.. Parts Score has earned my trust 1000%. Jason is an extremely detail oriented person. His followup and documentation is unreal. His shop and work area is spotless and his work speaks for itself. Leah the shop manager follows up to provide updates and even emails you pictures of the progress! They snapped some teasers of my car before I was able to pick it up! Very cool and personable touch!

Thus far he PartsScore has done performance mods for me: suspension (H&R coilovers), APR stage I/II, and some custom exhaust fabrication when aftermarket parts were not readily available . Also check with him before you order and European parts, he could of gotten me a better deal on some of my hardware. 

He will also be taking over the general maintenance for my car as he cannot be beat in terms of service cost compared to the dealer plus its always awesome to see what else they are working on back there. I have seen some wicked BMW M's and even Audi R8's getting full performance treatments. 

I recently learned they accept warranties too. Knock on wood I don't need it but if I do, Jason and the team at Part Score will definitely hear from me. Thanks for taking care of not only me but also my VW CC. 

You guys are the best!

PartsScore built my fully custom Volkswagen Cabrio show car from the ground up.  Jason and Leah are a great team with such creative minds and are totally customer oriented.  Their pricing is very reasonable, the quality of work is truly exceptional, and the attention to the small details just isn't found elsewhere, especially in this type of business.

From basic maintenance to full customization of parts, PartsScore seems to do it all, in reasonable time and at reasonable prices.

Rarely do you run across small businesses that actually enjoy their work. PS definitely loves their work and the cleanliness and organization of their shop shows that.

I 1,000000% recommend them for your European car service needs or performance part installation.

I can't give enough praise to this shop and it's owners; it is hands down the best shop in the Valley when it comes to servicing European vehicles! I was fortunate enough to come across Parts Score when I purchased a set of coilovers from the owner Jason. Since then, I've taken my 2011 GTI here for all of my routine maintenance and performance additions and modifications. The work is completed in what can only be described as 'expert perfectionism', and at a very fair price point compared to other shops and dealerships. Customer service from both Jason and Leah (who runs the front end of the business) is always over the top, which is honestly what compels me to keep coming back again and again. As long as I live in AZ, this is the only shop that will be taking care of my baby!

VW, AUDI, BMW, etc. car owners all around the Valley: this is the shop for you, you will not be disappointed!

I can't say enough good things about Parts Score. Leah and Jason are good people that know how to take care of customers and keep you coming back. If you have a German car, Parts Score is the only place I'd trust for aftermarket parts or maintenance. I've dealt with questionable performance shops before and been through those headaches, and Parts Score is a breath of fresh air. They're always accommodating, even for the particular requests that people that modify their cars have. Jason worked with me to do some VAG-COM tweaks that hadn't been done before, in addition to other work that they executed perfectly for me. Thanks to Parts Score for always taking care of things right the first time. As long as I'm driving German cars, I'm coming to you. My modestly modified car wears your Parts Score sticker proudly.

This place is an almost an hour from my house but i wont go anywhere else after the great service the first time i went there! Been back multiple times already and ive been 100% satisfied every time. You can tell they actually care about you and your car!

drove an hour from goodyear to a 10am appointment, i originally was going to wait(stated it would take 2 hours)  roll the fenders and adjust suspension, was also interested in some addition business if the first was a good experience, but i was able to catch a ride to hang in scottsdale for a couple hours, came back at 1230, was told my car was still being worked on, but Jason was on the phone, i noticed my car still parked in the same location and keys on the desk, waited 10 mins to be told they were busy and they didn't get a chance to look at it.  so in all wasted 4 and 1/2 hrs of my day, no phone call to tell me it would be longer, no email or after phone call to say hey, sorry for the terrible customer service to notify you we were going to waste your time and your appointment means nothing.  My time is valuable, I drove an hour for great service, I hope that warning assists others in understanding that you are not important, they don't care about the customer and you are just someone that can be blown off with no recourse.  Well, I'm a reviewer to include BBB, it may not mean much to some people, but I read them and people that do appreciate good service read reviews.  I your time isn't important and you want to give your money to people who don't care about you and treat you like a number, come to this place!

I used to always do my own work because I couldn't trust any of shops that was around me. I heard great things about Parts Score, but it's a bit far for me, so I kept telling myself that I need to take the drive to try them out. I've never been to a shop where I was 100% comfortable handing my keys over until I visited Parts Score yesterday. Not only did they take car of my car, the customer service was unheard of. Both Jason and Leah were amazing and super helpful! I will be bringing my car here going forward.

Where can I start... Well as a female going to an auto repair shop is something we always dread! We're always afraid to get ripped off or taken advantage of! I recently bought myself a new car and was told by a friend to have Parts Score check it out that they are awesome, reliable, and priced well. I made my appointment and told Jason and Leah my concerns. Jason did a full inspect of my vehicle, oil change, and made recommendations for repairs. He fully explained his findings and did not make me feel dumb, and in a way so I would fully understand. There was no pressure, there were options, and priced extremely well.  You can tell that they are passionate about what they do. I almost wish I had a nicer car so they can do all those fancy tricks and modifications. HA! 

I am lucky to have found such an amazing shop that will take care of me and anyone I refer to them. And more importantly, as a woman I will highly recommend Parts Score to all my friends and clients for hassle free-worry free-awesome service. I can't thank them enough for that piece of mind!

Just got my car back yesterday after removing AWE cold air intake,replaced by BMC filters, KW HAS install.
I have a a exhaust installed about a year ago at a nearby reputable shop.
It was rattling since day one. Installer could not find any thing wrong and could not fix the problem. I was so frustrated with it to the point I was looking to trade the car.
Jason and Austin found the problem in 5 min, and now the exhaust sounds great.
The car performs great.
Best service. If you have a BMW that you want to mod, this is the place for you.

I've been to several shops throughout the valley for a variety of services and none have come close to giving the service that Parts Score has.   Leah was incredibly responsive to all of my inquiries and extremely helpful in recommending parts.  I sourced several parts through the shop and their prices were lower than anything I could find online.  

When I dropped the car off, Jason took the time to go over the details of everything they would be doing.  He was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly.   They got the work done perfectly on schedule, and with fantastic craftsmanship.  

I've been to smaller shops ran by people in the scene that do good work, but at their own pace and schedule.  I've been to larger more commercial shops that do good work, but don't really take the time to interact or care about their customers.   Parts Score is at that sweet spot in the middle where they will get the work done expertly and promptly, but will also take the time to talk about and share their love of cars with the customers.  

I truly can't recommend this shop enough.

Awesome people, beautifully organized shop and very reasonable prices for good quality work. Can't say enough good things about Jason, who is extremely organized and meticulous. If you, like me- are particular and methodical, this is the place to come to for your car.
Great service and extremely reasonable. There is no better place to go in AZ for aftermarket work on Audi's, VW, or BMW.

This place is a gem! Was looking to get my BMW M6 lowered with H&R springs & get a front lip installed, was getting ridiculous quotes from other shops, I was recommended to call Jason at Parts Score, they got me in rite Way, charged me half what other shops were quoting & did an excellent job.

What impressed me with this place is the attention to detail they pay..Jason the owner takes great pride in his work.

These guys also do service on cars, I will be bringing my BMW here for all my service. 

Thanks for the great service & reasonable prices.

Absolutely awesome husband wife team.. They are just fantastic with their business manners and customer care .. They clearly care about their customers solely and not about money.. Jason takes time to explain everything and even takes u to his garage and shows u everything. They go out of their way to help u and dont nickel and dime you..
He does great work and had my car done in no time..i would give them extra stars if i could.. Thank u so much... Highly highly recommend them

I need to give a big thank you to Jason of Parts Score. Jason recently installed an ESS supercharger on my 328i, which is not that common of supercharger kit and the first he had installed. Of no fault of Jason's we had some tuning and diagnostic issues because of an anomaly with my ECU. Jason's tenacity in trying to work through the issues was amazing. This is the third time I've gone to Parts Score and each time I am blown away with his expertise, his commitment to customer service, and his attention to detail. Trust me, from a customer service standpoint I can be a tough customer, but Jason has exceeded my every expectation and he has earned a life long customer. Thank you Jason and Leah, I appreciate all that you did for me.

1st time having them work on one of my cars. I will be back! Quote was spot on and they are so friendly! I had them install parts on my S4 that I provided and he was not familiar with. Not a problem for a pro like Jason! Again super customer service and so nice to see a family business like this that you feel like you can trust with fair prices!

I was recommended to Parts Score by various people, however i'm very particular with my car. I drive a 2009 BMW M3 coupe and was looking to get it supercharged and also get some preventative maintenance done (rod bearings).  I was looking at quote of $11,000+ so trust me i did my research.  Ultimately i decided to go with them and i've never been so happy before.  Let me just say folks, Jason is VERY meticulous with his work probably one of the most meticulous people i've ever met his attention to detail is just ridiculous call him OCD if you must! The drive is a bit far for me since i live in Mesa, but it definitely is worth it.  Jason and the Parts Score family have my business and i'll continue going to them for my maintenance and performance needs!
JT is the best. I won't let anyone else touch my hair. She's been doing mt hair for 10 plus years, as well as my mom, Jean and friend Micah. We love her!

This salon studio,  run by JT, is a lovely and relaxing place to receive great services and stylish hair! previously from Liedan Mitchell in Chandler and Champs salon in Tempe, JT will take great care of you!!

JT has been my hair stylist for at least 8 (maybe 10?) years. So, yes, wouldn't keep going back if I didn't like how my hair turned out!!!! I met JT at Champs in Tempe (close to home), and consistently loved how she colored my hair... am a pretty traditional woman who wanted to hide the gray coming in... she does the best of highlights- low and high. JT moved to Leiden-Mitchell salon in Chandler...I followed her there... why wouldn't I? And, loved hearing her desire and ambition to have her own place. Koroyo it is!!! FANTASTIC!!!! Client (me) walks in... soothing... decor is stellar...and I know I am still getting the great talent JT has for coloring, cutting my hair.Just this last time, I have had soooo many compliments  on my coloring. If you want to find someone whom you can rely upon year upon year, JT is the person... Perhaps because of our long-term relationship, I think of JT as family... she is upbeat, stylish, and knows her business... hair!!!! When getting my hair done, I am at home with JT... She cares about her clients, and vice versa!!! Any first time person in the area, I can only say, make your appointment with JT at Koryo.... a lovely salon, a lovely person... 

The area of her salon is intimate... make sure you know where to locate it... Dobson Grove Plaza is the key to finding her place... 

As her salon has just started-up she is not yet ready for credit cards... but this will come soon!

This is a quirky small independent music shop with awesome record and games selection at fairly cheap prices. Be prepared to look to find treasures not yet sorted or ask to find in this Aladdin's Cave of guitars,tvs and film.
I discovered by chance(You Tube) but ideal for retro games or music dvd, cd gifts.

Well how would I describe the wonderfully weird Backtracks with its random range of items from video games to dusty records, CDs and VHS films to instruments, cables and golf balls, this shop is definitely one of a kind as is the shop owner Tommy. We love Tommy. Who doesn't love Tommy! 
But despite all this the shop is tiny and cramped full of stuff and I'm sure that underneath all the stuff there are some hidden gems, if you can take the time to really wade in and have a look. Overall a  thumbs up for Backtracks.

Squeezing my way around this messy shop full of old cassettes, dusty playstation games, roller skates, keyboards and scatterings of VHS videos I was reminded of the soundtrack to the film Trainspotting: "Choose a f@*king big television, choose washing machines, cars, compact disc players and electrical tin openers".  Indeed, in keeping with the film, you'd probably have to be on some drug induced high to find the concentration levels needed to rout through all the junk. Nonetheless Backtracks may well stock that Sega Mega Drive you've always wanted, or indeed that rare Super Mario game for your old Nintendo system. Such rare items can sell for hundreds on the likes of Amazon or Ebay so Backtracks could well be an option for the more nostalgic home entertainment enthusiast.

This is a shop that has clearly never heard the phrase 'less is more'.  I'm sure they have everything under the sun that could be considered music or games, but finding anything is another matter.

Only come here if you have time on your hands and are genuinely interested enough to spend a reasonable amount of time - I personally got bored fairly quickly not being an ultimate games fan.  For some, however, this shop will be brilliant slowly searching and never knowing what you might turn over and find, but for many of us it will just be too frustrating.

Walking past Backtracks filled me with magical hopes of finding one of Edinburgh's best hidden secrets with great finds of the musical vinyl variety. But I was soon let down. I've been here twice now, to see if it maybe I was just in a bad mood the first time I visited. When you walk in, and you can barely walk in, you're met with piles of records, tv's, stereos, and all kinds of other things that are hard to make out. In order to look through the records, you may have to move a box out of the way that is setting on top of the category or letter grouping for the record you're looking for... I had to do this on both visits. You're likely to trip over something on the floor whilst trying to find what you're looking for. And at best, the shop is extremely cluttered and messy. I love to support local business, but I think most customers would be lucky if they found anything in the shop primarily due to the huge mess that it is.

Backtracks Music is hopelessly hilarious. Never have I seen a place so full of junk. And that's not particularly a bad thing. Places full of junk are places full of charm. But my oh my, if you decide to be the one to sort through it all to actually find what you like, good luck to you. 

I've never properly stepped inside. I tried, but the felt like the whole place was just too precariously arranged. Like the whole thing might come toppling down at a wrong turn. And I'm notorious for really (really) not being aware of my own surface area. Or anything around me, for that matter. 

I did have a great deal of fun leafing through their record collection, though. They're all pretty cheap records, but I didn't recognise a single name, and didn't feel like taking the risk buying something rubbish. All I have to say now is: venture in at your own risk.

Amazing selection of music, computer games and disco equipment in this Edinburgh 2nd hand shop. Many more items available inside than it looks from outside in street. Handy if you want to buy a plug, guitar ,amp or tv cheap. Worth a look for collectors etc.

I love this store. It is so disorganized, at first glance, with everything stacked. Huge piles of... stuff! But ask the owner, he seem to know every single item in the store. And what price tag he've put on it.

Saw quite some rarities, including an Atari 2600 with 7-8 games (£69 incl. 2 games). Personally I fetced a couple of GameBoy original games.

Vinyl, dvds, video games, misc electronic equipment. It got everything - except space to actually move in the tiny store. Genuine.

Unlike another store I reviewed recently, I regard Backtracks as a bit of a junk store, but one I find has some charm.

A small shop near Tollcross, slightly obscured by a bus shelter in front of it, Backtracks is a shop you could easily miss. It is, as its title suggests, primarily a music and games shop (amongst some other... "stuff"). I am a bit of a music and games fan. Whenever I've been in, I've found a few treats regards the CD collection, as I rake through their collection. A great deal of them however, like others have found, I have never heard of in my life, and don't expect to hear of.

As for games, I would probably recommend elsewhere for the latest releases. Don't necessarily expect to find anything produced in the past five years. having said that, if you're a collector you mind come across some unexpected finds, especially on the retro line.

Prices are reasonable for the sort of shop it is. The owner is friendly enough. Browsing can become a little difficult with the shops small space, and chaotic and precarious arrangement.

Backtracks is a shop that will give you a sensory overload. From the many, many signs that highlight their bargains outside to the maze of CDs and videos within, it would take you a day to get round this place - and it's tiny as well!

It is a muddle of mismatched items, and all the stock is fuddled together. Precarious towers of unsteady videos lean towards you, 21 inch television sets are buried under jumbled household appliances, and the owner's desk is swamped with old comupter games. Vinyl LP's spill out the doors and old, cringeworthy singles from the 80s can be bought for mere pennies.

But I absolutely love it! I get a buzz out of places like this - you seriously never know what you'll find. If I had time, I would devote it to spending a day looking around this place since it's an Only Fools and Horses style Cave of Wonders. There were some singles trapped under the mish mash that looked appealing, and I'm sure I would find loads of stuff in here that either reminded me of my childhood, or were of genuine value. 

The owner is also really nice and will help you in whatever way he can. He's aware that it's a place brimming with stock but as I said to him, "At least there's more to look at!"

I love it, but I am itching to get my hands on it. Is it really creepy that I want to tidy this place up?

Calling car boot enthusiasts, bargain hunters and vinyl collectors. 

Packed floor to ceiling with potential swag, Backtracks is a shambolic, secondhand shop that sells everything from old record and tape decks to video and DVD players, lights, speakers and playstation machines. Some of them are neatly arranged but the majority of stuff feels haphazardly stacked or piled on top of older, dustier stuff.  

As the title implies, there's also crates and crates of well played 45s, 33s, tapes and DVDs. Prices are rock bottom and whilst lots of it could be categorised as bad or forgotten pop, rock, blues or classical, there are some classics from Pink Floyd, Jimi Hendrix, The Kinks, The Who and The Beatles if you're prepared to dig hard enough.

Well my food was with the exception they didn't know what #12 typically it's double cheeseburger but I actually wanted the Texas Double Whopper but somehow got a cheese burger. They looker puzzled, but correct it quickly.

My first visit - the chicken nuggets were dry and they forgot the sauce. Sauce might have made them edible but without the sauce, they were so dry, they were inedible.
My second visit a week later, the girl had a bad attitude and did not listen to my order. I specified no salt on the french fries and no ketchup on the burger. When I picked up my order, I asked her if there was no salt on the fries and no ketchup on the burger because it wasn't written on the receipt. She accused me of not saying I didn't want salt. I had to wait again for both items to be redone. Notice that there was nobody else in the restaurant. When the redo was done, I asked for the honey mustard sauce. She played games with me. She didn't want to give it to me. After practically arguing with her for several minutes and her attempts to give me plain mustard, that I do not like nor eat, she finally gave me what I asked for.  She was not pleasant about it.  She was also inappropriately dressed with tight leggings too long for her, all hiked up and no skirt, no long shirt, no tunic, nothing covering the leggings, just bare sloppy leggings.  She looked dreadful and her attitude sucked.  It was my second visit and I won't go back, except for freebies that come in the mail.  I don't care to be treated like that and when only one couple came in while I was waiting for my order, I would hate to think how she would handle herself in a busy restaurant. She had a long name that started with C.  I couldn't read it because she kept turning around. How this girl retains this job when she is so miserable to people, doesn't smile, doesn't say thank you - is beyond me.
I let their head office know.  They care.  I was promptly emailed back and asked for more details.  I was told they want to fix the problem.  I suppose it takes a while to weed out bad employees.  I have no idea how long this girl worked there but, I am glad they plan on fixing the problem.

This Burger King should be closed down.
Service is horrible, food is ALWAYS Awful.
I have learned my lesson. McDonald's down the street will be getting my business.

We eat lunch often in the area and seem to always have a problem with having the food correct for what we ordered
Dave
This Burger King needs to upgrade its menu. People are trending to more healthier foods. News flash- a low carb burger is wrapped in lettuce!  I didn't expect to eat a burger with a fork!
Drive thru is terrible.  Took 15 minutes from the time I placed order to get the food. Unbelievable and unacceptable. No more! !

Slow as hell drive thru...I have tried to give them a chance but on 3 seperate occasions I have say in line waiting for 6-8 minutes...I. stop here bc it's on my way to work....why does it take so damn long? I finally got to the window and asked what was taking so long and the girl said she was the only one on staff...who ever is managing that place is doing a poor job at scheduling...morning, lunch and dinner hours are your peak times you should be fully staffed. I don't care if you just spent a ton of money to make your building look nice...if the service is slow people won't come. Oh and to top it off she charged my card the wrong amount, then gave me the money back for the mistake but then didn't charge the proper amount to my card....you are losing money and my business.

I recently re-visited this Burger King location and felt it has greatly improved from the recent past.  My service was over-the-top awesome, and my food was really great.  I think people need to understand this location is near Sun Lakes, a retirement community, so the folks in this location have to deal with old people with bad attitudes (me, for example).  I have often been waiting behind some other old f**t and it literally takes them five minutes to count out all their GD nickels, shiny, shiny dimes, and pennies to pay for their meal - that's what makes the service slow - it ain't the staff, it's the patrons.  On several occasions I have taken out a twenty and paid for the POS ahead of me just so I can get them out of the way and order my meal (I have found most patrons order ice cream and coffee, so it ain't nuttin' much for me to pay it forward).  As another plus, I found this location to be spotlessly clean as compared to other Burger King locations.

I know that life in the fast food chain should be.... faster....but please if you give the order and one order is missing.....it's not good. Try to be accurate because driving back and complain is a waste of gas even if the store would refund. Damage control doesn't work here.

I literally waited 20 minutes at the drive thru for my order. Gosh I finished my tea 5 minutes in waiting and at least offer to refill it lol. I'm not sure if the long wait was because it was short staff. I only saw two humans in there. Besides the ridiculous wait, I'm giving it a three stars because I LOVE their veggie burgers:). If I was in a rush I wouldn't even bother with this location.

I visited this location on Mother's day and the first time thru they gave me different food than I had ordered. I ran back thru and the manager was extremely friendly and apologetic. Service was great and in the end he gave me 2 coupons and the wrong order as well. He seemed very genuine. Food tasted great!

So schöne natürliche Fingernägel hatte ich noch nie. Bin hier sehr gut beraten worden. 
Kann es jedem nur empfehlen.

Wenn ich mich irgendwo wohl und rundum gut betreut und beraten fühle, dann HIER! Ich lasse mich seit vielen Jahren hier "bearbeiten" und bin von den Ergebnissen immer wieder aufs neue begeistert und dafür möchte ich mich an dieser Stelle mal bedanken!

Ich bin zum Atelier Les Vernis gekommen, weil ich schöne Nägel für meine Hochzeit haben wollte. Da ich mit meinen Naturnägeln keine Probleme hatte, wollte ich diese auf keinen Fall mit irgendwelchen aufgeklebten Materialien kaputt machen. Mit Porzellan bleiben meine Naturnägel gesund, es ist super haltbar und die Nägel sind, egal ob kurz oder lang getragen, immer ein Blickfang.
Meine Hochzeit ist schon längst vorbei, aber genauso wenig wie ich meinen Mann wieder hergeben möchte, gebe ich meine Porzellan-Nägel wieder her!

Meisterliche Fingernägel ... diese Porcellannägel sind einfach unschlagbar und ich habe die gesamten 4 Wochen schöne Nägel.
Alles was ich an Natürlichkeit, Haltbarkeit und Pflege erwarte.
Wunschtermin! Parkplatz! Pünktlichkeit! Auch dafür ist gesorgt.

Mein Nagelstudio!
Nachdem ich schon viele positive Erfahrungsberichte gelesen hatte und ich seit längerem auf der Suche nach einem professionellen Nagelstudio war, habe ich den Versuch gewagt. Trotz meines schlechten Naturnagels habe ich jetzt super schöne Nägel und so natürlich. Klare Sache: Daumen hoch für die Beratung und meine schönen Nägel aus Porcellan.

Selbst der Weg von MANNHEIM aller 4 Wochen lohnt sich für mich.

Da ich im Business immer auf dem Punkt top gepflegt sein möchte und gesteigerten Wert auf einen gesunden Naturnagel lege , sind die Porcellannägel für meine Naturnägel genau das Richtige.

Ja ich war auch da!
Wurde freundlich empfangen, ein ausführliches Beratungsgespräch und ich konnte mich auch bei der vorherigen Kundin von der Qualität überzeugen.
Hier bekomme ich meine eigenen Feilen, der Arbeitsplatz ist top, was aber noch viel wichtiger ist ... meine wunderbaren Nägel ... und nun bin ich schon ein Jahr hier. Leider ist sie so gut, das man Glück hat einen Termin zu bekommen.
5 Sterne ... nur empfehlenswert.

Von Zürich nach Stuttgart ins Nagelstudio... hätte mir das jemand vor einem Jahr angeboten, hätte ich Ihn ausgelacht.
Heute möchte ich meine Porcellan Nägel nie wieder her geben. 
Mein Naturnagel ist gesund und meine Nägel sehen jeder Zeit schön aus.
Ich wünsche weiterhin viel Erfolg.

die Beratung war gut. Da ich noch keine Porcellannägel machen liess, zeigte man mir zuerst an meinem kleinen Finger, wie es aussehen würde. 
Ich war total begeistert und liess mich auch nicht von dem Betrag 169,00 Euro abgeschrecken. Als ich nun nach drei Wochen meinen Nagellack entfernte, musste ich leider feststellen, dass alle anderen Nägel leider nicht so gut angepasst waren, wie das Vorzeigemodell an meiner rechten Hand.


 Im Nagelstudio befinden sich zwar sehr viele Nagellacke, nur ist leider der, den ich für mich ausgesucht hatte, nicht sehr deckend und hinterlässt streifen.


 Von der Haltbarkeit der Nägel bin ich trotz allem sehr zufrieden. Nur die Qualität der Verarbeitung lässt zu wünschen übrig. 
Dafür ist meiner Meinung nach der Preis zu hoch,auch, wenn der nächste Termin NUR noch 128,-- Euro kostet,

Ich bin hier in den besten Händen, meine Nägel sehen sehr natürlich aus, sind geschützt und perfekt gepflegt. Ich bin sehr zufrieden und kann es nur empfehlen, die professionelle Arbeit von Frau Goldschmidt verwandelt jeden Nagel in ein kleines Bühnenbild und meine Nägel sind seitdem Blickfang bei vielen Gelegenheiten, für mich hat sich so ein großer Wunsch erfüllt. HERZLICHEN DANK von einer glücklichen Kundin !

So steht es in der Werbung ...."Nails Royal".. die Königin der PorCellan®Nägel ... hauchdünn wie ein Lack und hochbelastbar für den Alltag ......


 ICH WEISS JETZT ...DAS IST AUCH SO
Luis is just such a great and friendly person to deal with before you have had coffee in the morning! Always has a smile! And the drinks are always perfect!

I have been to shops all around Phoenix, my dad is a mechanic but lives in California... so I surely can't drive 600 miles to have my car fixed. I met Jesse through my co-workers. He had done work on both of their vehicles and still checks up with us from time to time to make sure everything is running smoothly. I was dumbfounded when I saw these negative reviews because he has done so much for  little cost, and was extremely fast! These guys are hard working honest people and I honestly wouldn't recommend anyone else. 

To the people with bad experiences.. typical when you bring your car in for a specific reason there will most likely be other things wrong with your car. Process of elimination.

The worst hack job shop I have ever seen!

I cannot say a single good thing about this shop. It is dirty, cluttered with junk and unprofessional beyond any belief!

The owner Jesse talks to you like he is your friend there only to help you out and lies to your face. I brought my car in for a small valve cover oil leak with 3/4 of a tank of fuel and had the oil changed with mileage noted before I dropped it off. I came back and the it was out of gas and I asked i people were driving the car since here were wrappers in the floor from fast food and he assured me no cars leave except for test drives. It was over 200 miles of test driving with fast food for a couple people for days.

Then I find out from Jesse that he doesn't actually replace gaskets but instead just makes a silicone mess and calls this good!

Somehow my car ran great when it ant there and came back with a slight engine knock too!

RUN AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!
Just a terrible experience, new dents to go with it. Should be zero stars because not all the work was done.

OK...so the car was ready a day earlier than anticipated...that was good. Now the not-so-good. Since this whole experience was so shady, we decided that, for safety reasons, we should have another, independent mechanic take a look to be certain things were on the up-and-up. Glad we did that...mechanic found a "laundry list" of things that were NOT done correctly, or even done at all! Most concerning...a punctured fuel line that had been taped with electrical tape!!!! Now, of course Gilbert Auto says that the car was never properly cared for...oil not changed, etc. Well NOT according to all of the maintenance records we have for this vehicle! Never missed an oil change...or anything for that matter. Car was in excellent condition...not so anymore. We're looking at another $500.00 in repairs, minimum. Some might suggest that we take it back to Gilbert Auto...to that I would ask you...would you go back to the doctor who cut off the WRONG leg???? I think not. DO NOT TAKE YOUR CAR TO THIS SHOP...

I had my Infiniti QX worked on and they did a spectacular job! I couldn't have been happier. They performed all the work very professionally and in a timely manner. Jesse was very transparent in the cost and it cost much less then the dealer I had used in the passed (that had also goofed up a simple oil change!)

Ich wollte endlich Augenlinsen anstatt Brille tragen. Und da meine Mutter bei Binder war, ging ich auch dorthin. Zuerst hat die Frau meine Sehstärke gemessen und entsetzt festgestellt, wie ich ohne Brille auskomme (ich trage die Brille nicht immer), denn ich sehe angeblich keine Autos! Also, sorry, aber ich habe Sehstärke von -1,7, und ich sehe sogar Katzen in der Ferne. 
Dann versuchte sie mir oberflächlich beizubringen, wie man Augenlinsen reintut. Nach 5 min. gab sie auf und sagte nein, bei Ihnen funktioniert es nicht, kommen Sie nächstes Mal. Zum nächsten Mal kam es nicht, ich bin anderswo gegangen. Dort hat man mir sehr ausführlich alles über Augenlinsen erzählt und alles beigebracht, und eine Probe mit nach Hause gegeben. Und wenn ich Proleme habe, soll ich kommen.

Service ganz ordentlich, aber nicht individuell auf Bedürfnisse des Kunden ausgerichtet. Großkette, deshalb günstigere Preise als anderswo.


 Bin dort mit einer Sonnenbrille (ohne Stärke) schlecht beraten worden. Wollte sie umtauschen, aber dies ging nicht, obwohl es ein Umtauschrecht gibt. Aber so die Worte der stellvertretenden Leitung:." nicht hier, da kann ja jeder kommen..."


 Ich geh da nie wieder hin!!!

Angeblich unzerbrechliche rahmenlose Brille für sehr teures Geld gekauft. Als dann beim Ablegen auf den Tisch das Glas mitten entzwei brach, musste ich die teure Reparatur trotzdem zahlen (Wer weiß, was Sie vorher damit gemacht haben!). Bei der Reparatur zerbrach bei denen noch das zweite Glas, da haben die sich aber nix bei gedacht. Die nächste Brille holte ich dann bei der Konkurrenz, die sich auch viel mehr Zeit für die Sehstärkemessung nahm.

Karen Tyler is a diamond in the rough.she is genuine ,helpful and stays within your budget. No is not a word in her vocabulary  she goes above and beyond to be helpful   and when you see the finished product  you are totally in awe .
Karen comes highly recommended  for any occasion.KAREN went above and beyond to locate and purchase a specialty item.  
She was punctual and came equipped with a whole team who were very efficient.
set up and tear down went smooth and quick.and stress free.

watch out for this one...

Karen Tyler hooks you in with her sarcasm, by working with you, adding creative input, understanding every detail, jotting down notes and sketches, and giving you a great price.. and then NOT delivering.

We had a wedding recently, and were pretty disappointed when many details were not what we had been discussing with Karen for hours and hours and months ahead of time! She showed up 3 hours later than the time she had repeatedly requested that things be ready on our end for her to start. The centerpieces had about half the flowers we specified on the contract. The bouquets were nice but very small. Certain details were missing, some were just... different. For example, some urns we had specifically picked out in her store were replaced by little pots covered in fabric.

The week of the wedding, she finds out that she can't order the flowers we requested as there aren't that many in stock--- Also some flowers don't come in the color we decided on with her, so she changed the order. Shouldn't she have checked months ago when we decided?!?

The estimates on price we had gone over for months in advance changed drastically the week before the wedding. Fine, she didn't include a few things in the estimate, BUT when it's a $600 increase... it kind of defeats the purpose of an estimate!!

Oh yeah, and the mandap (like a four-posted canopy/gazebo under which we have the actual ceremony) that she set up FELL DOWN! Karen later claimed that it only "lifted" and she can't account for wind.  We had a clear view from the changing room, and some of our guests even took pictures of this disaster. Luckily, our hotel's coordinator got it back up and screwed in and secured, something that should have been done from the beginning (maybe if she'd come on time?). Also luckily, our priest was late so there was noone and no fire under the mandap when it fell. She didn't fix the draping (which also wasn't like any of the sketches or notes she had put in the contract) after it was back up, so there's a lovely pole showing in all the wedding photos too.. RIDICULOUS!

In the end, some things were great.. but the stress of all this change and all the mess ups on the wedding day is not something worth enduring.

I can't thank Karen enough to coming to my rescue! 3 weeks before my Pakistani wedding I was left without a decorator. I was introduced to Karen and I am so thankful   I was because she made my dream wedding possible! In ONE day we planned out my entire Mehndi (a colorful pre-wedding event) and Wedding decor. She understood the special requirements of a Pakistani/Indian wedding...the bright colors, the furniture requirements, the sometimes over the top grandness that our weddings are known for. She understood my needs so well that if she couldn't find exactly what we were looking for...SHE MADE IT FROM SCRATCH (i.e all the ORNATE stage seating for 2 events). Did I mention she did this all in 3 weeks?

The thing about Karen is that she will make your event HER event...every time I met with her, she was excited, brimming with ideas, and so encouraging. If anyone is looking for a decorator who understands Pakistani/Indian weddings please please please save yourself the hassle and headache I went through with my initial decorator and hire Karen directly! She can do all your staging, flowers, center pieces, aisle walkways, entrance ways, dance floor decor, etc.. And she will do it with care, honesty, and sincerity. My mom is still getting calls from guests who say they hadn't seen such  a beautifully decorated wedding before! Plus, my husband is from Chicago and the Pakistani/Indian weddings there are decorated to the MAX and well, let's just say the Chicago guests were IMPRESSED! 

From start to finish, Karen was professional and yet sincere and that's the type of person you want to trust your wedding to!

We worked with Karen for the decorations and rentals for our wedding. Our ballroom for our dinner was not going to be available until during the ceremony, so I needed to hire someone to place my decorations and centerpieces while I was getting married. We met with Karen and discussed our preferences. She was very friendly and asked a lot of questions to clarify our vision for our decorations. Her office/store was pretty disorganized, and I found it easier to contact her via phone, rather than by email. On the wedding day, Karen constructed and decorated our chuppah and placed our centerpieces on our dinner tables, in addition to providing the table linens. The chuppah was beautiful, and our centerpieces were exactly as I had communicated to her. The only small negative thing was that we requested and paid for a unity candle holder for our ceremony. I didn't realize it hadn't been provided or placed until just before the ceremony, so our taper candles had to be laid down. Overall, I had a good experience working with Karen.

Incredibly disappointing! I think that this was the worst decision I made for our wedding. She didn't provide enough flowers and yet her quote increased at the wedding, and though the ballroom looked nice, the rest of the ceremony and event looked cheap and/or empty and/or full of glitches (thing falling apart, things left fallen by the alter..etc). She's nice but for the price we paid, we were so disappointed. I've just spent a lot of time in the floral industry lately and realize now how much beauty and care could have gone into this event but didnt. For what we paid, I've seen stunning weddings with lush florals and it saddens me when I think about what we got. Honestly, three years later, I still feel disappointed in the wedding flowers she provided. I would not recommend her.

Karen Tyler at Tyler's Custom Designs is a gem! She is creative, helpful and very responsive.  Always willing to go that extra mile in making me feel at ease for my special event.  She can work with any budget and often suggests creative ways to still get the same look for a better price, which for us, was just what we were looking for. Her work rivals the best of Scottsdale's and in my opinion, is better! Visit with her and you will see what I mean, you will book her on the spot and trust me, you won't regret it!

I found Karen on Yelp and Wedding Wire. The price was awesome, flowers were gorgeous and Mandap was Amazing.  Karen was creative and responsive to my requests.  Score one for style and my budget.  Even my wedding planner was impressed.

Karen did the flowers, center pieces, chair rentals, and sashes for my wedding.  We actually paid for fake flowers for our centerpieces and Karen ended up receiving extra of the flowers for my bouquets and she ended up making all my centerpieces out of those extra flowers at no additonal charge.  Karen was super easy to work and very affordable. Her staff showed up exactly on time for delivery too. Overall great experience

Where do I begin ...

A couple months before our wedding, we hit a few roadblocks and realized that we needed some additional support to pull off our wedding (to put it lightly).  

Karen and her daughter Brenda are amazing.  They are honest, patient, detail oriented, friendly, genuine and professional.

From the beginning, Karen sat was willing to sit with me to discuss every detail of our wedding design.  She brought a lot of experience and helped us identify any potential issues we had in our plans.  She came to the rescue for our rehearsal dinner and reception.

Our florist is closed on Saturdays and had to deliver our reception flowers on Friday night.  The venue didn't have storage for them so we had to get a room at the hotel to store over night.  Not only did Brenda coordinate the delivery of the flowers, but she showed up at the time of delivery to ensure that they were safe, came back in the evening to check on them and showed up bright and early the morning of the wedding to check on them yet again.  On the day of the wedding, they carefully moved the flower arrangements from the hotel room to the ballroom and set up our tables.  Then after the wedding, her staff broke down the decor and returned the rented vases to the florist the following day.  They even helped us to put the final touches on a couple of our designs.  They can do it all and execute with extreme care and professionalism.

Everything turned out exactly as we'd discussed.  It couldn't have been more perfect and we owe so much of the success of our events to both Karen and Brenda.  If I ever have another event in the Phoenix area, or if anyone needs a recommendation ... I am sending them straight to Karen.

If you give them a chance, I know you'll feel the same!

Me and my husband will never forget everything that they did to make our day special!

Tyler Custom Designs was amazing! My wedding turned out so beautiful. Karen and her staff were so easy to work with and prices were very reasonable. I couldnt do it without her. I will defintley be using her for my next event!!

This place has been my store for almost 7 years on and off and I love it. All of the employees are really nice and super helpful. I was extremely lost after the remodel and employees would actually walk with me and explain how they were lost too. I've been going for so long that the employees know me and it makes me feel special.  It's really clean and red box is a plus. Also they are putting in a gas station which is so awesome!! I can't wait till it's open and I don't have to drive far to get gas anymore.

Clean store. Self checkout is a plus. Pharmacy used to be 24 hours, when they got rid of that feature I started visiting the store closer to me. They also have had trouble having my meds in stock. The fried chicken is a guilty pleasure.

This Fry's has a nice deli and bakery area! I like their sub sandwiches, and they are one of the few stores that had individually grilled chicken pieces for sale in their deli. 

Good selection on most items. They have great sale prices in their weekly ads. They have lowered their prices a bit to be more competitive. I also like their digital coupons you can find on their app.

Ok this review is for the pharmacy only. Since the Walgreens by my house went out of business I moved my prescriptions over to this location, and I'm seriously regretting it. In the span of time that has elapsed since I moved my prescriptions they've lost my medications, not had my orders filled at promised times, apparently added on STRANGERS under my name (the woman I spoke to today kept asking if I was picking up for a woman named Christine; there's no one that should be under my name other than me), and today's icing on the cake: told me that while they just got a shipment of my medication in the morning I came to pick them up, they could not fill my prescription to the quantity needed. I now have to come back AGAIN later this week for them to give me the amount my prescription says. How does that work? Not to mention that I ordered the meds on Friday and was told they would be ready the next morning on Saturday. It's Sunday. Almost every time I've gone to pick up my medicine it has been an absolute hassle. It seems that when one pharmacist makes a promise they do not pass it on to the others so there is a ton of confusion between pharmacy employees. This is getting to be ridiculous, and even though Walgreens isn't in range of my insurance or my house I'd rather go back to using them if this continues. No one else seems to be having as much trouble as I am when picking up my meds, and I've already tried with at least two different pharmacists to smooth out the problems they had getting my prescriptions transferred over already. There should be no other problems at this point. Please fix your systems!

I hate the grocery store for very good reasons. Their "fresh produce" is never fresh. They always look hours from rotting and are always busted up with bruises and scratches and open wounds. The only reason they are so cheap is because no one wants to buy them. My mother bought a small box of strawberries that were the only ones that weren't moldy in the store. Literally the next day, they turned white. My dad has bought a melon that was molding from the inside out. There is a theme starting to emerge. My mother also bought a "fresh" fish that she cooked that night. The meat was so rubbery, similar to cooked squid. We threw it out. My parents still occasionally shop here when they see deals from flyers but I have major trust issues with its quality.

It's probably in your best interest not to come here for groceries. It's crowded with hundreds of grouchy and rude shoppers with no disregard for common courtesy, and it's just so messy! Pro tip: watch where you step and don't wear nice shoes! The produce available was dishearteningly sad - I saw visible mold growing on some of the vegetables and bruises and holes on others. Sure the prices may be cheaper, but for the sake of your health and well-being, I'd advise you to skip this and head to Foodymart (if you're inclined on getting Chinese groceries).

Tread carefully.   There's deals to be had here but sometimes their produce is not that fresh.   Other times, it's better than other Chinese grocery supermarkets.   It just depends on your luck.   I rarely come to this supermarket because it's crowded and you kind of have to fight your way in to get produce that is on sale.   I don't feel good about nudging or elbowing an elderly woman to get oranges...... However, that guilt goes down when they ram into you with their Cart or body check you.   

Parking is available.  But like all Asian establishments, you want to park further to minimize your risk of getting your car scratched by poor drivers or lazy people unwilling to put their cart away.   

If you really want to save money, Yes come to this supermarket..... But be ready to fight those Asian moms for sales and line ups can be long, especially if you pay with credit.

I say the only reason to come here is when something decent is in their flyer (or if you live really close).

Staff: They mostly speak mandarin here. They aren't exactly the most approachable staff but I will say they are fast. I tend to feel Asian establishment has nailed down cost and efficiency. While Western establishments focus more on customer service and experience.

Store: To put it bluntly, it's messy, which isn't unusual. Unfortunately, where they completely lose it is quality. Although there's the occasional flyer deal that can't be beat, I can't see myself coming here for my daily groceries.

There's definitely better options and locations for groceries but sometimes they have excellent bargains.

Great food, low prices. Your basic mom and pa dinner, but definitely worth the stop! Great service too! Everything is freshly made, and nothing seems like it's frozen! They easily have the best mac and cheese, and you can tell it's home made! 
Breakfast, lunch, and dinner! Fed 2 of us for under $20!! Would highly recommend!

I love this inexpensive restaurant.   The food is good and service is wonderful.  It's like have breakfast at with friends and family.  The staff is intuitive to see when you just want to eat and run or sit and chat awhile.  One of my favorites
