So we were looking for a bar where we could actually carry a conversation without yelling.  We were the only ones in the place when we first got there as it was earlier in the night, but a small crowd showed up as the night went on.  The bar tender recommended either the Philly cheesesteak, or the open face ribeye.   We both ordered the ribeye for a cool 10 bucks and were thoroughly amazed.  I would have easily paid $25-30 for this thing!  It was the best steak I had in half a year.  I also got a chance to sample the fries, and the chicken strips which were also amazing.  I can't say enough about the hospitality of these people.   They were friendly, experienced and accommodating.  We had planned on having dinner, a couple beers and a few games of pool and spending an hour or two in this place.  The hospitality and quality of the establishment kept us from leaving, and before we knew it we had been there for 6 hours.    I'll just say that if I lived in the area I would definitely frequent this place.  I spent 3 days and 2 nights in Vegas and my best memory of it was this bar.  Once you get tired of losing your money in the casinos and paying ridiculous prices for weak drinks come here and start really enjoying yourself. When you walk into "The Hammer" you are living the champagne lifestyle on the beer bottle budget.

Hammer & Ales on Russell rd is a great place to stop by for a beer and service is wonderful. I drive by coming to & from work and always wanted to stop in.

I was greeted by a much friendly bartender and caught her has she was leaving only to be greeted by her relief. Well, service got even better. Two young bartenders vey friendly and attentive! 

I noticed they do have have a kitchen but haven't eaten here, yet. 

I will come back again.  The service is just with coming back to!

Dive bar...you betcha.  Cafe lights string on the ceiling and their 24 beers... well it seemed like they were out of half of them.  Not good for a holiday weekend.  No food was being served but we were offered BBQ that was sitting out for an event they just had.  Really was expecting more  we'll see how much better they are after they go on the air Sept 8th.
Awesome! Beer taps are quality, seating comfy and great vibe. This is vegas building culture.
It's wonderfully divey and you never know what you're going to get from night to night, but that's part of the charm here! It's a great place to start the night, and end the night!
Nice little spot with a coin-op pool table.
Great beer selection - food was better than I remembered

I came here with a small group of friends today for a private belly dancing class. Our instructor Chemagne was very encouraging and explained all the moves and how to put them together to create a seductive belly dance. Its not as easy as it looks and for a beginners class (1hr) you work up a sweat. 

For first timers we were a bit rough in execution but did not let that take away from the fun we all had, both the music and positive attitude that come through in Chenagne's class makes me want to come back and try another style of dance. 

The studio is a bit small but can hold 5 - 10 people but any more and I feel it would be too crowded, there are change rooms upstairs and the studio is easy to get to as it is a 5 min walk from Ossington Station.

Booked a belly dancing class here as one of the activities for my sisters bachelorette party and had an amazing time! I haven't laughed so hard in a long time. Chemagne is absolutely lovely and managed to loosen up 6 of the most uptight, type A personalities - which is quite the feat. If your looking for bachelorette ideas or just a really fun time I would highly recommend this place. Would do it again in a heart beat!!

WE ate here our first night in inverness and it was great that it was open fairly late on a Sunday night (nothing else was open) the food was quite passable not great or even that good but good in a pinch.

I have had several surgeries with Dr. Barget and can only say this office is a delight to work with.  The staff members are wonderful and Dr. Barget is one of the most highly recommended periodontists in the Valley.  He is kind and compassionate.  Without a doubt goes above and beyond the call of duty.  Thank you Dr. Barget for all the help you have given me over the past 10 years!

I was pleasantly surprised at how pain free and smoothly my gum surgery with Dr Barget went. I was expecting to be in extreme pain-this according to a few friends who had the surgery previously done by another periodontist. However, my experience was quite the opposite. I took it easy the day of the surgery and followed Dr Barget's post operative care instructions. The following day I had no swelling and very little discomfort. I was able to go about my normal weekend activities. I am now about a month post-op and all healed. Dr Barget and his office were extremely professional and caring. I would highly recommend Dr Barget for all your periodontal needs.

I was referred to Dr. Barget for a surgical procedure of crown lengthening which was completed back in December. Not only did I get an absolutely beautiful result but his expert direction in my overall treatment made a tremendous difference in my case. He has a warm, self-deprecating manner, explains things completely and I was just simply really comfortable in his care. The IV sedation that knocks you out is FANTASTIC. Since then, I've been back to have my teeth cleaned in March and loved the hygienist, whose name currently escapes me. My experience was exceptional. Perio surgery can be scary and expensive, but if you need to have it, there is no one better in the valley!

I have mixed feelings about this salon..

In my first few years in Montreal, I used to come here all the time. Especially with a young woman at the academy named Elizabeth...Then, a series of unfortunate events took place in which I had 3 or 4 bad experiences in a row after she disappeared which prompted me not to return. (ie. the only thing keeping me there was Liz...but they wouldn't tell me where she went...so upsetting.)

The place is quite nice, and is very clean and well established. However, the prices can be ridiculous depending on the level of expertise you choose, in which case, if you're brave enough, you can book your appointment with the academy upstairs.

Definitely a nice place to relax..and the stylists all seem to know what they are doing so go try it out! 

A nice little plus...any time you refer someone to them, you get a small gift! Definitely a nice incentive to say nice things about them :)

I highly enjoyed my experience at Tonic Mt-Royal. I had hair treatments booked in advance with three friends. We arrived on time and the from the moment we walked in, I felt relaxed. We were offered beverages and had our robes on within minutes of arriving. From there we were whisked off for botanical therapy hair treatments. A short head massage after, my hair felt healthier immediately.

After we were directed to the blow dry bar where we were had access to every Aveda hair product on the planet as well as brushes and combs of all sorts to get our hair ready for the day. For $30 it's well worth it.

We both got great cuts here. Guillame and Jess were our stylists. Very happy with the cuts and nicely priced. ($45 men, $65 women). They even gave us $25 each, off of our next visit. Highly recommend.

I went here for a work party. Its a beautiful building!! I can't believe it used as a club. Reminds me of 'This is London' but more authentic architecture. They had a fireplace inside...is that really a safe idea with drunk people around? Iron bars and all, people can be pretty ridic when they drink...

So because it was a work party, I ended up taking full advantage of the free drinks tickets on my possession. After becoming highly inebriated, I danced the night away! lol, the music was terrific. The people...were mixed. I actually much appreciated it was a work party. The 'other' people that were there, well some of them looked a bit punk/were a little rough on the dance floor. I suppose I'm saying I might not go back there for just a regular night of fun. But to put that in perspective, you're not likely to find me at the docks (is it still called that? yes I'm old) or the government (ok are these the same places? I dont even know...)

You know what I love about 'nice' clubs-they have nice bathrooms. This place sure did. And for those of you who have endured nasty bathrooms in not-so-nice clubs, you will understand my appreciation :)

Oh I should mention, I'm pretty sure there is cover on weekends $20. But again, because it was a work thing, we didn't pay!

And my friend (designated driver!) parked on the street for free, no problems at all

There are times in life when spending the rent money on a single meal is actually a pleasure, and can be part of one of those evenings that's the stuff of special memories for years to come.  

There is a bare handful of truly first-class, exquisite, opulent places in Toronto where your dining experience is so much more than food on a plate, where only the finest in your wardrobe will suit you, where you want to make marriage proposals or celebrate a major anniversary or otherwise ritually mark the most sublime and special of occasions in life.  When I know I'm going to plan such an evening with a special partner, it's the Courthouse Market Grille that I personally keep in my back pocket.  

I don't have to tell you what's on the menu, but I'll definitely recommend their steaks.  You should already know that it'll be among the best meals you'll hope to have.  Ever.  Trust me.

The good news? It's right next to Terroni. The bad news? The beer selection, at least for the night I was there, was Bud and Bud Light. What? Isn't there some kind of Canadian content law for beer? OK, I wasn't expecting Mill St. or Amsterdam but not even Molson or Labatt? I did see some empty cases of Stella so maybe I came on a bad night.

Place itself is loud but I like the back room with the couches. There's also free WiFi if you can find the manager and he gives you the password. Even still, he gave me the wrong one and I finally figured out on my own to place a period in between the letter and number sequences. At least they had it.

Skipped the beer for obvious reasons and tried a screwdriver. Very weak. Mostly tasted of Minute Maid. So even the drinks aren't so hot. It's a decent start but it's got a long way to go to be a really great downtown club. Stick to Terroni and go drinking somewhere else for now.
Pretty decent venue with the open floors downstairs and a top balcony level.

This little hidden cafe was worth the trip to find it. After visiting Vampire Penguin in San Jose I've been looking for a place to find "snow" dessert. And my hubby wants a closer boba place. 

The menu is small with not too much variety but there's enough to make you want to try it. They have smoothies, boba, and the snow fluff I've been looking for. Plus some real food options.

It's a newer place so it was quiet when we visited but it looks like a relaxing place to hang out. I see its potential. And my hubby liked their boba. 

Price 4/5 it's about what you expect to pay. Good potion size though. 
Food 3.5/5 I liked it but didn't fall in love. But I would like to try more. 
Overall 3.5/5 like I said, it's a newer place so it might not blow your mind but I want to see it succeed. 

Check it out!

Great place for boba tea, smoothies, and juices. They're kind of tucked away, along the same strip as Tom's Bbq and Thai Dressing. I stumbled upon this place after filling my water containers at the water and ice in the same corner. They had an A frame on the street pointing where they were..... Since I'm a sucker for cafes of all sorts, I decided to try them out. I have been happy with everything I've gotten there. Usually will get the taro tea with boba, but have also tried a couple smoothies and juices. I heard they're gonna start making "snow" too, with different flavors and topping options. I'm excited to give that a try when they have it. To top it off I have received excellent service from this place every visit, from every employee. Absolutely 5 stars from me!

Great green juices the best I ever had.
They serve full glass full of juice and not filled with ice.
I would not go back here and it's 3 minutes from my house. The smoothie I had was awful, and the service was slow. There is only one person working.

This probably one of the better Middle Eastern restaurants I've eaten at in Northern Phoenix and they are a very nice family run restaurant. The food is great, the prices are very good and it's very fast ... you can't beat that!

Love this place! Great tabouleh, falafel and kibbeh. Decor is a little antiseptic so best bet is takeout. Family run business which is great. We have generally went to Sabas but after trying Kabob house we haven't been back to Sabas once.
Unhappy about the hours. Change the yelp ad. You guys are closed Sunday! I drove all the way out to get my favorite food to find you are closed.... Common now!!

These guys are great. 

Extremely friendly and nice service. Food is perfect, I wish they would dim their lights and make more cosy atmosphere. The food sure deserves it. 

Anyway, this restaurant well deserves full five stars. 

Food is great. 
Service is careful, accommodating and friendly. 

Everyone should try it out

I was in the Kabab House for the first time on Sunday night and I simply loved it. Great family owned business that had fresh food & a great feel to it. I'll be going back and I would recommend it to anyone. Great experience.

This place is FANTASTIC! Very generous portions for the amount of money your meal costs. Get the gyros!  So delicious. Everything is made fresh to order. Their hummus with the ground beef was very good. This place, while not fancy, definitely is comparable to The Persian Room at a fraction of the cost.

So I was super excited when a new middle eastern restaurant opened up within walking distance. Unfortunately, I'm left pretty disappointed.

To the staff's credit they were incredibly polite and the service was great. Unfortunately the food was simply bland, especially the hummus. I'm pretty sure they just ground up some chickpeas and called it a day.  Also the food took way longer than it should have.  The cook must be pretty new to this whole restaurant thing because they only cooked one meal at a time. I had to watch them cook and serve the 2 other people who arrived before me one by one in order.  Given that pretty much everything served here is either already prepared or grilled, they should be able to prepare multiple orders at once.

I'll try them again in a couple months just to be fair, so I hope some garlic and spices finds it way in to their food.
This place is AMAZING and DELICIOUS!!!! The food is authentic and made to order. I would come here everyday if I lived closer. Don't miss this tasty and satisfying new restaurant!!!!!

I saw a sign for this place on our way to the movies this weekend. We stopped by for lunch after our movie.

Place is small and so so. Service was really good.
We had the humus with meat (great idea), hubby had a gyro sandwich (pita wrap) and he loved it. Fries were good too, tasty and crunchy.

I had ordered a cubideh sandwich (wrap) but ended up just eating the humus, and taking the wrap home.

Hubby thought humus was kind of bland, I thought it was OK.  The meat was like hamburger meat but with herbs and spices, I liked it very much. The portion was reasonable (~$8, it is an appetizer).

We want to come back to try the grape leaves, the baba ganoush, and the tabouleh.

The best Middle Eastern food I've had in Phoenix!  I tried this for the first time last night.  I asked the gentlemen if they were family recipes and he said of course.  I will say, I am incredibly picky about my falafel.  I try it everywhere and outside of Saba's, am consistently disspointed, no matter how good the other dishes may be.  When I tried this falafel, I knew I had found a place for me!  Additionally, the meat was so tender and delicious!  The kabob mix, with chicken, beef and kefta was amazing!  The food is incredibly fresh an excellent quality.  I will agree that the hummus is not as flavorful as some I had, but it was still very fresh.  Since it's a family recipe, I just thought maybe their family didn't like as strong of a flavor to it?  Plus I find most people to think hummus is supposed to taste like the stuff from the market or Trader Joes.  That's not real hummus.

 It was a bit slow in preparation, but they haven't been in business that long, and making everything fresh does take more time.  It's not a nice, sit down dining environment.  Fine for a lunch or whatever, but just don't want anyone to be disspointed if you're doing here for a nice dinner, but the food cannot be beat, so perfect for takeout or a very casual dinner.

Ordered takeout from the place and the food was great. We got the gyro salad, a side of falafel and also the gyro plate! Definitely will be coming back for more! Have been wanting to find a good mom and pops Mediterranean place nearby and this is it! Decent prices for a good amounts of food!

All the food is very fresh and incredibly delicious. I had the falafel plate, which included not only 6 falafel patties, but a salad and a generous helping of hummus and pita. Everything was prepared to order (not ahead of time) and spiced to perfection. The staff were very friendly, to boot.

What a wonderful surprise, this restaurant was. This is a family owned restaurant and they are all so nice and welcoming. I had the kafta plate which was more than enough food. They do a special trick with the rice which makes it taste like no other. You will have to give it a try.

Our new favorite resturant for a weekday date night! We werent sure what to expect at first when walked in. Though we were happily surprised by both the great food and kindness of the employees! We ordered the Gyro plate and the Kabab Koobideh plate. They both came with a generous portion of rice and a wonderful half salad and at a decent price! It left us full but not overly stuffed. We'll definitely be back with friends and look forward to trying more of the unquie menu.
super fresh food..great prices. ala carte and entrees both.
The service was great and the variety on menu good. All food prepared up front visible to the customer which I like. The food was great, be prepared to leave full.

Delicious. The salad is outstanding. The kebobs were outstanding. The humus is bland, bit well made. The iced tea is terrific. The staff are friendly. The prices are reasonable and the servings large. I had to try the beef egg roll; quite different and fun. We will definitely return.
My new favorite Mediterranean food restaurant! Great food at a great price. Wonderful customer service. The grape leaves and gyro are amazing

My Daughter, grandsons and I were looking for something fast and healthy so I Yelped Restaurants in area we were in......the reviews were great so we went with them!! Soooo glad we did..............the service was outstanding and the food Delish..........She and I had the Kafta Combo and loved it!!

One of the boys had a cheese burger (go figure) and loved it too and the other ordered the Falafel (from watching Kickin it) but was not crazy about it (prob too young to appreciate different cultures yet) so Mom switched plates with him had his  Falafel, and he loved his Kafta ..............bringing Dad next time!!

Great food, and great prices.  The family and staff are informative and kind.  The food was very fresh (I watched the lady make my foule and I watched the guy make everything else right in front of me).  

As a caveat, I don't think I would classify this food as "Mediterranean" or "Greek."  I would call their food Middle Eastern and Arab, which is what I expected.  Regardless, it was good.  I think Yelp controls the classification.

Great Food! Good Service! Very friendly family owned business. I'll be back many times! I love the food. The chicken, the bread, rice, salad. Everything is great. Very fresh, quick service and wonderful.
fantastic to have a true Mediterranean restaurant where everything is fresh and tasty. try the yogurt drink...perfect!  chicken Sharwma was superb. my new favorite local restaurant

I am always SUPER excited when an authentic ethnic eatery pops up in my hood. And Kabab House definitely did not disappoint!

It is right by our house and after passing it countless times we finally decided to pick up some takeout for a late lunch.

I ordered the falafel pita and my husband had the chicken schwarma pita. My husband picked it up and said the family that ran the place is so nice. The guy at the counter even gave my husband a free soda because he felt bad about the short wait for food.

He brought our food home and we were surprised when we opened our food boxes with the enormous serving of french fries that came with the pitas. They were piping hot and sprinkled with a unique seasoning. We were only able to eat about a third of the fries, since our pitas were huge as well. My falafel pita was awesome. Very flavorful. My husband loved his chicken pita and said the seasonings were perfect. They gave us sides of sriracha. That is a restaurant after my own heart.

I highly recommend Kabab House. Lots of delicious food for a reasonable price served by a very nice family.

Hey for a small mom& pop convenience mart, this place has stuck it out over the years. Nice personable guys, always a pleasure to stop by for cigs etc.
Price is right and they hardly ever run out of stuff. It's convenient for me on the way to work etc. and they open early and stay open till late.
Hope they stick around for a long time. Thx, Happy Holidays guys!

This store has a little bit of eveything. They have cheap beer prices, all my favorite snacks and tons of cigars and blunt wraps. It's my one stop shop. It's kinda cool to be greeted by the employees since they remember me everytime i come in.

This store is a little weird like one reviewer mentioned.  It is frequented a lot by the students who attend the nearby Moon Valley High School. 

However, once they start loitering around too much and in large numbers the owner of the store will tell them to take a hike.

They have check cashing services.  Money orders ( When its working ).  This is basically a ghetto Circle K with-out the Circle K sign ( Used to be a Circle K though ).

I like this store because I can cash my checks there especially when the recession kicked my butt and I lost my checking account.  

The check cashing fees are slightly lower than the competition but thankfully I am back on my feet with a checking account.

A&S Cactus Express I'm a fan and you should be too if you live in the area and a need a check cashed !

This looks like your basic cash-checking & beer/party store on the SE corner of 35th Ave/Cactus. But inside this quasi-bodega, you'll find some interesting items, such as the following: Mexican sodas (incl Coke) in thick glass bottles, Cisco ghetto wines, ice cream, and a few smoke shop items. For all of you who are unfamiliar with bum wine, please read: http://www.bumwine.com/cisco.html

There's a barber shop next door and a drive-through liquor store in the adjacent building. This store is just weird in so many ways, I'd recommend stopping in once just to take it all in. I think they buy gold, too.

I'm not really into the performing artsbut last summer at the Edinburgh Fringe myself and a few mates decided to go and see a thirty minute performance of a play written by a feelance playwright after being assured it free and scary by a girl on The Royal Mile.  We were called 'gay' repeatedly by the rest of our friends but we set off anyway, hoping to be terrified and maybe catch a few free refreshments whilst we were at it.  The play probably would have been pretty scary had any of the audience actually understood what was going on.  
Church Hill Theatre itself is actually quite impressive.  The man hall isn't enormous but it has some impressive artwork throughout and it had a good, enclosed atmosphere.  The refreshments were were also pretty good but, unfortunately, not cheap, costing about £3.80 for a small tub of ice cream.  Having done some research I found out that it also hosts Lothian Youth Arts as well as other clubs geared towards those with an interest the performing arts.  For this the people who run it are definitely due respect and if it's your sort of thing then Church Hill Theatre is a great venue to see a performance.

A magnificent building on the outside and enthralling plays on the inside, this is a great theatre to come to for a night out.  It's a fairly small theatre so its atmosphere is more involving and brings you closer to the heart of the play on offer.

As a theatre it offers more than many of your corporate theatres including amateur theatre groups.  These are my favourite of all theatre productions and what I believe real theatre is all about.  It's not quite grass roots and these productions are very good, but still raw and exciting.

It is worth a visit and will offer a good night out, but also offers a variety of classes over time.  Finding out when these are on can be a bit of a struggle, but checking the boards outside every now and then should keep you updated with what is going on.

This theatre is absolutely gorgeous, stunning from the outside with decor which compliments on the inside. 
This was my first visit here and have to say it didn't disappoint.

Morningside's generally out of my way, so I don't venture there often. It's not really far, per se, it's just it's not on my way TO anything so I generally miss out on stuff that goes on there. But I went to Church Hill Theatre to see a friend of a friend in a production of Hair. You know Hair, the infamous hippie musical from the 70s. It's hilarious and worth a watch. 

The production itself was really fun. But as far as the theatre goes, it stands also on its own. It's really gorgeous on the outside, and equally gorgeous on the inside. The lighting and all was done really well, which I tend to think is creditable to the Theatre itself, as well as the people who work on the lighting. The sound was good, too, so kudos to both the sound engineers and the space itself.

If you ever find anything going on there, definitely go. It'll be worth it.

this another place that i would give no stars to if possible. 
it's been on the corner of mill and university for as long as i can remember, which is impressive since nothing older than ten years has been able to withstand the rent increases, and even more impressive because i don't know a single person who goes there.

i went in there one time, for drinks and walked past one of the foulest salad bars I've ever seen. for some reason, it's right by the door. instead of walking in to see a hostess stand you walk right into this brown mess of vegetables.

after seeing that first off, i wouldn't dream of ordering food here. the place is also dark and dirty and there's never anyone inside of it.

seriously, I'm really curious how this place survives. awesome little neighborhood wing and live music joints like long Wong's get torn down for high rise condos, yet gross, ghost town ruby Tuesdays hangs on the corner of main and main of Tempe. what is wrong with the world?

I ate here cause it was New Years eve and I needed a place to eat quick to energize myself before a night of heavy partying. They had some $1 beer specials and the mini burgers and fries were not too bad . This place is just too dark and dingy though. I would give it  2 1/2 stars.

I saw their commercial and looked at the menu online.  It looked decent enough.  Total meal was $50.00 for three people and the food was AWFUL. My daughter's burger was dry, my steak was oily and greasy and my wife's spaghetti squash had a nasty sauce.  My wife also had the salad bar and she said that was bad too.  The little muffins they serve you were the best part of the meal.  I eat out quite a bit and love places like Chipotle, Salt Cellar, Vincitorios, Flemmings and many others but this place is terrible.  I'm just hoping I don't get sick this evening.  You've been warned.

This place isn't a that great.  Sure, they have a beer special after 9 p.m. but no one goes here for drinks.  They're burgers are terrible.  The drinks are okay, but considering the price, they aren't that good.  I hear the salads are good since I never tried them myself.  The service is mediocre and the restaurant is just average.  I would advice just going to Chili's across the street.

Aretha Franklin was right:  Chains are for fools.   Ruby Tuesday's has always sort've blown me away when it comes to how hard they try to not be a TGI Fridays clone but yet still fail miserably.   The food at Ruby Tuesday's is predictably average with service that varies from piss-poor to pretty darned good.

Most recently I enjoyed the Ruby's Minis (sliders) at the bar and the wife enjoyed a broccoli and cheese soup and the salad bar.   The soup was salty and not great but the salad bar and sliders were  yummy.   Plus, they have dos XX lager (not amber) on tap which is a rare and tasty find!

Hooray for Tuesdays on a Monday..errr..or something.

I recommend this place to everyone! Every reflexology session I have had here puts me to sleep!If you are battling pain and or tension from stress, just pay this place a visit! I feel brand new when I leave and days later! The results last because the quality and care given is second to none!

Awesome massage and reflexology location! If you are in need of relaxation and release (my two favorite R & R's) then this is your go to spot.  I received a 1 hour massage and 1 hour reflexology session, pure bliss!  Both of my therapists were so friendly and sweet.  Thank you so much "E" and "T"!

I purchased this as part of groupon special. It took along time to get an appt. or even  get a response from them. Once I did, there were limited appts. I booked for Friday evening. The place was hidden in the interior of an office complex, the signage does not say the actual business and in the dark it is very difficult to find.  If you are a woman, I personally do not recommend booking an evening appt. as even the parking is not well lit.  The massage was good, but not great. Ambiance was nice and the therapist was very nice. I have one more groupon to use here, but most likely will not frequent this place regularly.
Phenomenal massage and reflexology - she really knows her stuff and doesn't rush you through like many other places!

I wouldn't go back.  Bought a groupon for the 1 hr massage and 1 hr reflexology.  It was a bit strange that the office didn't say Essence on it so I wasn't even sure I was in the correct place when I arrived.  Also, it was weird to me that they do colonics there.  When I went to the bathrooms there were signs about if you use to much toilet paper and to spray afterwards and use the fan.  This was just not what I wanted to think about before a relaxing afternoon of treatments.

Also, when I tried to book my appointment the hours are very limited.  I didn't even get a call back for about a week and a half.  Then had to book for almost 2 months out.

The massage was done by a lady I liked.  However her touch was VERY soft even after I said she could be a little harder.

The reflexologist was not my cup of tea.  The treatment was most relaxing for laying in a dark room with my eyes closed and calming music.  Otherwise I would have gotten nothing out of it.

I came to this business due to a Groupon coupon. It dd take a while for the place to call me back and get me in. This happens with certain Groupon deals especially one with limited hours such as this business. It is a new business so the owner is trying to deal with all things new. I am certain that she will get it together soon. As far as the services, the reflexology was good. I am going in for a second session soon.  I am however  very impressed with one of the therapists (Tiffany). Great healing hands of a goddess .. she knows her stuff  and is accommodating. Once one gets past all the minutiae;  the place has a great growth potential. Although I have regular massage therapists that I love; I will make a point to use Tiffany and recommend this place.

I usually tell people about amazing places but I rarely write a review about them on Yelp (shame on me). However, this place is so great I had to write a glowing review. 

Hands down, Essence Reflexology & Massage exceeded all of my expectations. She is super friendly. The ambiance is very relaxed and the massage is... ahhh-mazing! 

Totally relaxing, and totally worth it.

typical large garage charges are over priced and mechanics seem determined to make ther bonus by findind faults that don`t exist. customer service is below par too when i booked car in for service at 10am i thought it would get seen then not after lunch time! leaving me without a car for most of the day! not worth going back .

When the air conditioning failed in my VW Caravelle I had a handful of garages mis-diagnose the fault and fail to fix it. Graham's team quickly got to the root of the problem and fixed it for a fraction of the cost I was quoted by the dealer. Very down to earth and authoritative explanation of the problem too.
Great diagnosis and frank advice every time. Very impressed with their professionalism.

A small Garage with quality service and is very quick in maintaining car/van etc. I booked my car for Monday and was given a courtesy car as my car was being maintained. The customer service was also brilliant as they were kind and helpful. I recommend this garage and will definitely be back. The price is also very affordable.


 Probably the best garage in the North of Scotland

Tucked within an office building, I would have never learned about Croque if my friend had not suggested it. We came during peak lunch hour, and being that we were the only diners there (often a warning sign to me), I was a lil weary of how good the food would be. Yet, I wholly enjoyed my Soperssata cold sandwich (reminiscent of Genoa Salami) that featured large slabs of feta (I think this place is BIG on feta!) and a tasty basil-pesto spread. My friend got the Croque Special Sandwich...def. want to try next time I visit! 

Service was fast and what you expect from a deli-like place (read: nothing special). Sandwiches are served on what appears to be like a chopping board. All sandwiches range from $6-8. Will return! In addition, they have a N. Scottsdale location.

I absolutely love this place! I've tried many of the items on the menu and have not been disappointed yet. It's a little pricier than some places, but you get what you pay for! Working in the same office complex it's convenient and easy. I prefer their sandwiches rather than the salads, but then they are known for their sandwiches. You have to have the garlic sauce. It's the best!!

This restaurant has been here for quite some time, hidden along a side street with office buildings surrounding this restaurant. It's been under new management for the past year or two.

My company orders lunch from here quite frequently as they do deliver to our office and, being so hot here in the summers, they think it's worth to have the lunches delivered.

To me, it just so, so.  I've tried about 4 items on the menu and I'll have to be really hungry to order something from here.  

What I had:
Turkey club tortilla wrap.   I've tried this sandwich the way it should be made but the french bread consumed the turkey and bacon, so I thought I would have them make it in a wrap. Like I said, it's just so, so, and for the price they charge, it wasn't a very big wrap ($7.75)

Very small menu, their menu consists of Salads (7 different varieties), Wraps (3 items), Breakfast (3 items), couple of items from France, Italy and America (Philly Steak, Roast Beef, Turkey Club).  

I've had better for the prices they charge (average price $8), and their portions are not large, but if you're hungry enough and you don't want to go out in the heat, it's ok.
Amazing! Everything is SO good and they have let me in when they weren't open so I could get my pumpkin cream cheese muffin fix!

I love, love, love this place!  I randomly found this bakery online while searching for a bakery to make gluten free wedding cakes in Arizona.  I called them up and they were the most accommodating and helpful people ever.  They took on the challenge of making my gf wedding cake even though they had never attempted to make a wedding cake before and they made the best gf cake I've had.  The guests at my wedding were clamoring for my cake even though we had a regular one for everyone else!  When my husband and I visited GF Creations they had a tiny 3 table bistro just off to the side of the bakery.  I'm not sure if they still have it, but it was cute and we were able to sit down and eat.  I had a burger on a gf hamburger bun and my husband had a gf reuben.  Very tasty.  I would also highly recommend picking up a pie if they happen to have any when you visit.  I tried their cherry pie and it was awesome.  Overall I think this place is a dream come true for any gluten free person out there (they also cater to other allergies as well).  If you ever find yourself in Phoenix you must check it out.  You will not be disappointed.

Gracious, I'm reading all of these 5 star reviews and I must say, I very much disagree. 

1. The location is squeezed between two buildings, and is really dumpy. 
2. You literally can't fit more than 5-6 people inside.
3. They offer about 12 things that are sitting in grimy refrigerators.
4. There is nobody there to help you...I came in and five minutes later a lady popped her head out from the back, said "ring the bell if you need anything" then went to the back, never to be seen again. (Even though I rang the bell like 5 times...and called for her) 
5. It smells god awful in there. 
and 
6. It's much too expensive. 

In short, I wouldn't waste my time.

THE BEST CAKE EVER!!!

I had my wedding cake made at GFC, because I am allergic to wheat and milk.  The cake was beautiful and the best tasting frosting I've ever had.  I have been craving that cake ever since!

Have been to the bakery three times and enjoyed lunch twice this year.  The environment is friendly and lunch combinations very tasty (Ruebens, etc.). Samples and take-home goodies are so yummy--conversation between tables very delightful for the friendly customers and staff!

Atmosphere is warehouse, but the food wins the stars. You take it all home or eat it in the car on the way home. 
Prices are really good for fresh gluten free food. We think it is actually better than Mariposa in Oakland, CA. That says a lot.
Thanks GFC for the great quality.

you have to make a concerted effort to find this place...but if you need or choose to be gluten-free it is so worth it. there are a million things i want to try but haven't yet..right now we are stuck on the jalapeno cheese bagels (delish), the buttermilk biscuits (i am originally from the south and these get the southern seal of approval. yum!), and the hamburger buns (i can't believe it's not gluten). my relatives back in tennessee are requesting i fed ex the plain bagels and biscuits...they are not inexpensive but they are so. good.

I was recently in Phoenix for the day and stopped at the bakery (the cafe location FKA Lulu's Cupcakes) for lunch and to get some baked goodies to take home. I'd heard a lot about this restaurant (there aren't a ton of choices for us Celiacs) and couldn't wait to try it. However, my first impression wasn't great. The cafe is in a hard-to-locate dingy shopping center. Interior of the place isn't much better. Its clean, but atmosphere-free. Although they have seating and advertise themselves as a lunch spot, the clearly don't expect people to eat there - the bathroom is used partially as storage, and the only beverages available are a small selection of canned sodas and bottled water.
And the food was...ok. My Reuben sandwich was tasty and on a very nice mock-rye bread, one of the better gluten-free breads I've had. But it was small (smaller than a normal sandwich I'd make for myself at home) and extremely expensive (a $9 sandwich? Really?) I also sampled the cheesecake while I was there. It was fairly tasty, but reminded me of those frozen Sarah Lee cheesecake you can buy at the grocery store; I'd accept a piece if it was offered to me again, but certainly wouldn't search it out. I also took a chocolate muffin and a chocolate "whoopie pie" home with me. Those treats again were ok, but nothing to write home about. They had an identical texture (muffins and cakes should feel different from each other) and left me with the chemical aftertaste so common to gluten-free foods. Since I can make brownies from a mix that taste better, I won't be buying any of those desserts again.
I won't be going back - I can make better treats at home, and the gluten-free faire in my home town (Tucson) puts this place to shame.

I am in love with the herbed baguette ! Finally I can have a bread that tastes good ! I love that there are now 3 locations in the valley for those of us who have a myriad of food allergies. All of the breads and etc. are frozen. But yummy, nonetheless. THE only thing I have not loved is the plain baguette. I got one for a Jeep outing with my boyfriend, and it was crumbling in our hands when we made our sandwiches on the trail. The herbed baguette is awesome. As is the herbed pizza crusts; calzones and cinnamon rolls. MMMMM.. such a treat for a food allergie'd person like me. The staff is so helpful and there is also a punch card for your purchases. I am just happy to have this bakery for options!

*Please note that this location does NOT serve food in spite of the pictures of delectable sandwiches!!! To enjoy prepared food, please see their other location at: 7607 E Mcdowell Rd # 108, Scottsdale - (480) 990-2253. Their kitchen hours are: Tues-Fri 10am-4pm and Sat 10am-2pm. 

As other reviewers mentioned, this location is a little hard to find. It is located behind the Midas shop in a bright yellow building. Very limited space when you first walk in. They are very helpful when pointing out vegan items!

Hard to find, but painted all yellow, so once you see it behind all the other buildings on the lot, you'll know it.  Would highly recommend the simply pizza crust...a vegan gluten free creation and yummy!  The cookies are decent as are the bagels...altho' they are more like english muffins than bagels.  They always have samples out to try...each day's a different theme.

Mmmmm the donuts are so good. Honestly, I am not a big fan of the bread or bagels here, but the frozen deserts and mixes are great. This place is hard to find and very small so more than two people inside at once is a crowd. But since everything is frozen (and should stay that way til you want to eat it), I just go once every couple months to stock up on goodies. It is definitely worth a visit because you might just find something you have been craving since you got off the gluten  : )

I am NOT a celiac, but eat gluten free by choice.  My son has nut and egg allergies also but eating disgusting Udi's GF bread was not an option nor something we needed to do but we do try vegan baked items for my son ....but I definitely feel eatging GF helps my IBS....so i was shocked to taste the amazing delicious Awelicious bread, pumpkin choc chip cookies and even ordered a GF birthday cake.......yes, it's drier, but who cares, it still tasts AMAZING!  Try the GF brownies too, they rock!

The Gluten Free Bakery has inspired the mothers' day gift basket I'm making for my step-mom this year. I just returned from a quick lunch hour visit and stocked up on English muffins, everything bagels and snicker-doodles. Each of these items is frozen so I don't have to worry about them spoiling by Sunday -- so long as I keep them in the freezer. Total cost so far: $23. 

Thanks to Yelp and Kym C. (http://www.yelp.com/topic/phoenix-gluten-free) I'll be grabbing some finishing touches to round out the basket at Sprouts 25% off sale. 

Put it all together in a pretty basket with fliers from Gluten Free Creations that list restaurants that use their product (possibly a gift certificate to one of them) and retail outlets to purchase more - I think my step-mom will be really happy with her gift!! Can't wait to give it to her on Sunday!!

Wir haben dort mehrmals gegessen, als wir noch in Ulm wohnten. Es gab vor 3 Jahren nicht grad viele Alternativen)
Wenn man sich Zeit läßt, kann man(n) schon ne ganze Menge Teller anhäufen ;-) Und sooo schlecht war die Qualität nicht.
Allerdings folgte dann immer eine gesalzene Rechnung...

Conveyor belt sushi restaurants rock. You get a variety of sushi come at you and you pick what you fancy. caveat - you gotta go at the right time. When's the right time? During peak lunch or dinner times. Why? The sushi chefs will put out a good variety of different plates on the conveyor belt.  Otherwise, if you go when it's slow, the plates and variety go down significantly. 

If what you want isn't on the conveyor belt, ask the waitress and she'll bring it out. They also serve entree dishes but I haven't tried them yet.

Do NOT use this HT if you plan on grabbing a few things before work. This location is most convenient for my commute, but all 3 times I've stopped, it's taken 30+ minutes. I guess moms do the weekly grocery shopping after dropping kids off at school. Which means waiting in line for 20 minutes for 3 items. There are usually only two registers open in the morning and self checkout isn't open yet. I tried to get customer service to check me out and she told me to get in line. Will never be back to this location.

1 star only because this store is very clean and organized.
Never had a single problem here.   Of course Harris Teeter is a little more expensive than say, Food Lion or bilo, but there selection is so much better if your looking for certain items.

This is hands down my favorite HT in the area.  Huge, clean, great selection and most importantly always has everything in stock.  Prepared meal options range from salad and asian bars, handmade pizza, subs and sushi.  There are always loads of samples to try as you shop.  And the cashier's are always super friendly.  It is always packed but has plenty of parking.  As their jingle goes, "my harris teeter"
This store is open 24 hours- yay! The staff here are super friendly and the store itself has an easy to navigate lay out. Fresh & delicious produce!

Just moved to the area and have been very impressed with this Harris Teeter.  The store is always clean and the associates have been very helpful.  Keep up the good work Harris Teeter.

PS...Thanks for the Veteran Parking spaces.  Nice gesture.

A perfectly nice grocery store with some upscale options like fine tea, olive oil, chocolates etc. However it irritates me how they are always lacking in produce.  

I can't say that I would make this a big shopping destination, if I lived here.   I would want more free range meats et al. (I'm from California, what can I say.)

Service always has a smile...  that IS a nice thing.

Plenty of parking, with a drug store and a liquor store (ABC) in the same location.  Handy since you can't buy hard liquor in the grocery store or on Sundays out here.  (meh)

Harris Teeter is a great supermarket chain,  but their Rosedale store has always been one of the worst ones in the area.     The deli is disgusting,   and I've seen employees doing unsanitary things there.   Their produce section (as mentioned by the above reviewer) is very poor and just not displayed nicely at all.   The store is badly in need of an expansion.  It's far too small and cramped.  This isn't one of the better Harris Teeters.    The Peninsula store (exit 28) or additional Huntersville location on Exit 25 are much, much nicer.

I was in Huntersville for a college graduation celebration and ran one of the last errands to Harris Teeter to pick up some catering trays.  The staff at HT has always been helpful when I've visited here and this time was no different.  The deli staff was more than accommodating and helped us get all our goodies to the counter in one piece, including a 1/2 sheet cake!

The quality and presentation of the food purchased was great and quite plentiful!  We have HT here in Northern VA now and I like their stores very much.

I am extremely disappointed with the bakery department.  My wife ordered a cake with my daughters face in a princess body Sat. for Sunday pick up for my daughter's b-day.  The bakery took the order Sat.  I had picked up the cake Sunday.  I explained to my wife when I got  back and explained that  that the baker said that they ran out of ink, because they were busy with graduation.  The bakery department never called to let us know of our order.  we had no choice but to take the cake, since it was my daughter's b-day.  Also the cake showed some damage to the side of the cake.  Lesson learned; go to Publix for all needs.  I will sure to pass this situation on to my family and friends.

Improving my rating to 4 stars. The delivery service is now enhanced by the 'Order Ahead' feature in the HT app and I NEVER have to wait for my order to be filled. Order before i leave home and pick up my order from the refrigerator case on my way to checkout. Easy peasy.  It's obvious management is attempting to address customer service in the delivery as well.  

4 stars as long as I order ahead!

Harris Teeter in Huntersville, NC (and Corneilus, NC) are ridiculous in their prices!!! Especially since BiLo closed....They are nothing short of price gouging!!!   They are trying to get every penny they can before Publix gets here. Surely they realize how they're turning their customers against them?  It's so bad.  I for one can say for sure that they will not hold my loyalty at all. When Publix comes in, their will be no more Harris Teeter for me!

My previous experience with Harris Teeter was with only one location. And from that location I was in love. Little did I know, that the Harris Teeter I frequently visited was not the best of the best.

This location is huge and mostly busy. My most recent visit allowed me to explore the store a little bit. I have visited previously but it was always just a quick run in and out to get cash.

This location has a few more food stations including an Asian bar. The produce section also seemed larger but that could be due to layout.

Honestly, I have never had a bad experience at any Harris Teeter but when I took a moment to walk around the store, I was in love all over again.
This place is great except for the deli. Management must know how bad the service is here. Plan for no less than 30 minutes to get some turkey breast or just go to Publix next door.

Went in for a quick beer run. Now let's do some math: 1/2 aisle of beer + 1/2 aisle of beer = 1 full aisle of beer. Add to that end cap with seasonal and 4 types of Mother Earth + more displays down the center. Just muliply times 5, don't forget to carry the 1. Well, anyway you get the point. Nice selection. Fast checkout. And their scanners can actually read your loyalty card bar code off your I phone. Now everybody sing together "My Harris Teeter!"

Idk what's been up with the teeter lately but customer service has seen better days. I've had some pretty apathetic cashiers that you have to squeeze a "have a good day" out of sometimes. I've gone to get pizza slices the past two weeks and no one is ever at pizza counter...or maybe I just have horrible timing. I stood there for what felt like forever and finally a guy from deli counter helped me at the pizza station.  The prices sky rocket during triple/double coupon so just avoid that week unless you have coupons. 

Overall I'll always like Harris teeter but publix next door is starting to be more appealing.

yes, they are everywhere in the south.
I like it that you can go into a store in Va and it's laid out the same as one in Carolina.

Remember when you were a kid and you'd go to the bank with your parents and the teller would give you candy because you didn't scream like a banshee while waiting in line for 15 minutes? Well, if you take your kid to this particular bank, the kid won't have time to scream; there's literally no lines. Ever.

That's what I like about this bank - they have their stuff together and whip people in and out in a quick minute. I doubt I've ever been in there longer than 15 minutes, except the time I opened the account. It helps that it's relatively close to my house.

The tellers are friendly and actually remember what I do for my paychecks. It's a bit weird when there's actual customer service (aka, they remember who you are) because, well, there's not a lot of that these days.

This isn't an ING account so you're going to get basically nothing in interest, but the account works fine for checking. I love that I had the option to NOT have over drafting (it will just automatically decline the transaction) which I don't think I was ever asked when I used to bank with Washington Mutual/Chase. I've never spent so low that I'm in fear of over drafting, but I think it's a really great feature that they offer and I like that I opted to have my transaction automatically decline should that happen. 

I'm happy with the bank, the only thing I really dislike is that I signed up to not get statements in the mail to save on paper, and I still get loan, credit card and air line mile ads from them - defeating the point of saving paper. 

Overall, I like US Bank and will stay with them for checking, and put savings into silver (aka, not into a bank account.)

I love this bank.  I have several accounts with them including a small business checking account which is totally free.  All of my accounts are free, one of them requires a minimum balance.  I have had a few fraudulent incidents happen on my accounts and US bank took care of it quickly and with ease.  I do wish there were a few more in town.

I HATE US Bank!!!!  They try to squeeze me for every single fee they can.  I have auto deposit on 2 accounts plua a savings and a car loan for over 4 years and still they want to charge me $10.25 a month for a maint. fee!!  Makes me crazy!!!  A small amount but are you kidding me?  And then when you call they have excuses adn packges to discuss and want to upsel you on this and that and never resolves my problem.  This is why I have a savings and checking at Wells Fargo as well - and they are no better - fees fees fees - no incentive for moving to another bank.  And I have learned it's to no advatage to have all your banking at one bank.  I think I will check out a credit union.

Before the staff was fabulous.  BUT of course they were promoted.  Now, since the new managers have arrived, service noticeably dropped.  The manager doesn't know what she's doing; rude, easily flustered as another patron indictated.  It routinely takes me 20 minutes now to make a deposit and honest it's not like it's in pennies and they have to count it. Last time after 15 min wait, she left a bunch of us at front cashier desk taking the only teller into the back -- with huge line waiting for service -- and left money on the table.  I'm moving my money it's that bad.

My co worker had suggested I use Philosophy after she used it and got awesome results.........Of course anything to help my face maintain my youthful skin......I got a sample and tried it at home wow talk about instant results....my daughters and my mother noticed how clean my face was and how my face just glowed........

I now am the proud owner of the Philosophy face wash Purity and the Exfoliator face wash...I love it I am faithful..........it is also gentle enough for my off spring to use,,,,my mom is also treating herself to this lovely experience

Next I will be purchasing the Oxygen Peel and the Eye Serum.


Thank you my very crafty Co worker Marcella thank you so much for this introduction!
I love philosophy hand and body lotions.  "handmade" smells like lemon custard and is very hydrating.  Not too crazy about their Hair products but the lotions are amazing!
I recently had an order from them stolen from my front porch & they sent me a second shipment @ no charge and even expedited the shipping for me!! Excellent customer service...thank you!!!

Great shop and a lot of help. I was surprised to find Pyrite here for a kids pioneer activity I was having for my church. After having searched all over town I finally found what I was looking for. Im sure I will be back

Dragonstar is great store for beginning Pagans, Wiccans, New Agers and other folks who are just starting to figure out their own spiritual path! The owner, Jane, is always so patient, helpful and willing to listen to you. Jane knows most everyone in the Valley, including the names of all the Wicca covens and other Pagan groups. She can deal with both new witches and old-timers in the craft.  Her store is a bit small, but the owner can order any item for you such as herbs, magical oils, crystals, tarot cards, runes, books, and music CDs......Plus, she also contributes to the local animal charities by collecting dog and cat food!  Good Karma! 

Stop by for a good chat and good shopping! Blessed Be!

I love coming to this place, it is a true shame that it is so far out of my way.


After my first visit this place quickly become my first stop when I needed those odds and ends that no where else has. Great for gifts or personal collection as well. They have a selection of cards & runes, decent assortment of books as well as jewelry and incense. If I had the money I would love to buy the little statues as well.

The owner is always there and always friendly (atleast for me). Personally, I think this is a place all new age fans should visit.

Just moved to the Mesa area from Tucson.. and was looking for a local pagan shop. I came into DragonStar today and found heaven! The store was a bit smaller in size, but had great products, prices to match, and just a positive feel.

The owner (JANE- i believe, might be wrong!! Sorry!) was beyond amazing! She had great customer service, a great attitude, would answer every question with no hesitation, and wasn't pushy.

The store is a little hidden in a corner of stores.. but its worth checking out!! It was great doing business with you darling!

Sean

Great selection of products. She has Statues from various pagan faiths, plus a few fairies and dragons. Altar cloths, cloaks, skirts, runes, athames, incense. You name it, Jane probably has it! Not to mention she is knowledgeable and fun!

My first time in and I'm hooked! I'm horrible with names, but the lady that helped me with crystals, was wonderful. She answered all my questions and gave me helpful suggestions. She has great energy. Highly recommend coming here for purchases of any crystals.

I am absolutely shocked that there are no reviews for this gem yet!! Everytime I visit this little shop I leave in such a great mood! The owner is very nice and akways willing to answer questions. This store stocks a selection of books, incense, statues and even some apparel. Its hard to find a place that carries new age and pagan items around here, I usually have to drive all the way out to shops in Phoenix. I suggest checking out the Facebook page to double check the hours for the day, as she posts changes in hours there. Dragonstar is definitely worth checkin out!

nice little store located near a major cross-street. Plenty of great incense, herbs, and oils for your every day needs. Very reasonable prices. Not to mention, the owner is always friendly, and answers plenty of questions. I have already recommended this store to several friends for supplies for ritual. :-)

My husband and I just moved to Mesa and found this shop. We love going there for our incense and a genuine discussion about the different products within the store. We also love getting the reiki candles for our meditations as well. :) Where we come from (Idaho) we would have to travel 3 hours to find a genuine store like this. The shopkeeper has fantastic customer service and always answers questions so kindly. She has tons of candles, incense, books, stones and crystals, and statues. Also the music she plays, which she also sells, is very soothing :)
Excellent service. First time there and I was treated like a long lost friend. This will not be my last visit!
Un des meilleurs sandichs que j'ai mangé á Mtl! Ils sont bon et pas cher! Beaucoup de choix de viandes. Ils sont tellement populaires qu'il est préférable appeler avant pour commander!

Good place for student who need tasty food but don't want to spend too much money.

I always order 1kg meat with my friends. It's a good portion for 2 people. Also their sandwich is great, plus you can ask them to add some fries  inside the sandwich to make it better.

Place won't give you a good impression since it's a small place and not so clean. You should call it before you go for take-out. Save your time and make you happy.

We were there tonight around 7pm just want to try this place WHAT A BIG MISTAKE , WHAT A BIG MISTAKE.
Extremely dirty restaurant 3 idiots who works there simply they don't give a sh.t about the place  , used napkins on the floor , greasy tables all the dirty trays are accumulated on top of the trash can ( at least 15 trays with dirty napkins and leftover food ) from the floors to walls to the ceiling  you'll see dirt , what  caught  our attention is that nobody was complaining about  how dirty the restaurant is. What we witnessed is  group of people finished eating got up from the table left dirty plates and napkins on the table 2 minute later different party comes in and without hesitation they put there sandwiches on the dirty table and started enjoying the food .,then one of the guys who was cooking the kebabs comes picks up all the dirty trays from the top of the garbage can and  without cleaning them he puts it next to the barbeque area and uses the same tray for next order . We were very surprised that not even 1 person complaining about this disgusting dirty restaurant until we started observing the kind of people were coming in , Curious? Dear YELPERS  go check it out and find out about what kind  of people goes there and you'll know what Iam talking about.  HEALTH DEPARTMENT SHOULD CLOSE THIS RESTAURANT .

I hadn't been to Farhat in a few years.

While the prices are decent, the quality, service (a little lost, best to order ahead) and premises (still grungy) falls short.

Most people get the sandwich with their choice of meat,  but I tend to favor the kilo mix ($22).

You get 2 regular and 2 spicy Kefta kebabs , 2 ground chicken kebabs as well as 2 chicken breast kebab and 2 "filet mignon" skewers.

It tastes vary from Ok to just good, they add a salad and some hummus, garlic sauce and harissa.

The best part is the spicy bread grilled over charcoal and the bottom pita that catches the oil drippings.

This is just my opinion,  but the staff are North African making Levantine cuisine. That could explain why the hummus is from a can, the lack of SUMAC and offering french fries and baguettes.

The Spanish might make decent pizza and the Chinese can have a go at Sushi, but most recognize the best place to get ethnic food is at the source.

Best Kafta sandwich I had. Served on a delicious sub bread versus the usual pita bread. The meats are grilled on wood coal and gives it an amazing taste. The fries are nothing special but they are a good representation of what middle eastern fast foods offer and taste great paired with the garlic sauce. This place will not break your budget but will use up your patience. It can get very chaotic to even just place an order. The waiting is a bit long. So save yourself the headache and order by phone in advance. The place could be cleaner too.

If you're looking for something different, yet middle eastern this is your spot. Make sure to try the merguez sandwich. The only downside to this place is if you're driving, parking can be a huge hassle. The food is rich in flavor and not super expensive. If I'm in the area, this is a spot I won't miss.
New location same amazing food at the same price. New location is 5785 Côte des Neiges. Just down the hill of their old location

Tasty but not so clean premises. They prepare spicy grilled meat or chicken sandwiches and grill the sandwich which makes it crispy and tasty. 

The down: Sloppy and disorganized. Not uncommon to wait 15-20 min for your sandwich.

Trevor and Amber are great and easy to work with. They came to my home to provide an estimate, and gave me options for upgrades to my original plan, and the total job cost was extremely reasonable and fit my tight budget, and they use high quality paint. I even made a decision for a color change just a couple of days before the start date, and they took that in stride. I had the entire interior of my condominium painted, including repairs to wall damage from the previous owner. The workers were very respectful and did a wonderful job protecting my furniture and floors while they applied the paint, and followed with an excellent job of clean up and putting things back where they started. I trusted them completely to do their work while I was out of the house. The job was completed from estimate to finish in about a week. it is wonderful to come home to my new and improved colors. It seems like a brand new home. They also painted the interior of my daughter's house to prepare it for sale. It looked so good that it was sold within a week of completion. If you want a new and improved appearance to your living space, don't hesitate to call them. I know I won't if I ever need to paint again.

Best painting company in Vegas!  We have been using Trevor for the past few years on several properties.  He does a superb job at a reasonable price.  I am never disappointed!  Pays attention to detail, cleans up afterwards, and he uses the best quality paints.  What more can you ask for?  Thank you, Trevor!

Trevor and Plan B are outstanding!  Their work is top notch and their pricing is very reasonable.  Not only does Trevor do great work, he gives back to the community...when our non profit group, Project 150, which helps homeless high school students in Las Vegas needed a resource room painted at Cheyenne high school, Trevor stepped up to the plate and transformed a dingy, unused room into a beautiful resource room that the homeless students could come to and get the resources they need.  Excellent paint and dry wall company!

This has to be one of the biggest Tesco stores I've been in and similar in size to the one in Springburn, Glasgow. Huge variety of products on offer though some of the prices were more than what I would have expected. Apart from that there seems to be a real lack of staff with queues at checkouts frequently. Customer service here is much the same - seems to be the thing with Tesco that there are no assistants around when you need one. There is also an instore restaurant but after my previous experiences with Tesco even in the 24 hour stores, I expected this to be shut when I went in after 6pm so I didn't even check it out.

Based in a large retail park consisting of pet shop, cinema, gym and clothes shops, this particular Tesco branch boasts the highest sales of any supermarket around the Inverness area. It has a large electrical and clothing area, much larger than the other local Tesco, and tends to be able to stock lines that the smaller stores cannot.


 Saying that, the customer service lets the store down. Staff are always rushing, reluctant to take you to anything you ask for, and the queues at the checkouts are often horrendous - for that reason, I would suggest avoiding the store on a Saturday.


 Still, everything you need under one roof is something you cannot complain about.

A really large store with lots of selection of cheeses, pastries, meats etc. There is a massive selection of clothes and wines on offer. There are large selection of CD'S, Mobile phones, laptops and gadgets. It is located near a cinema, gym and lots of large stores. Overall a great place for bargains.
It is a large tesco store. There isn't much more to say about it other than it is annoyingly convenient if you commute along the A96 and has a petrol station.

This is a large Tesco at Inverness Retail Park. It was extended a few years ago. It is the biggest Tesco in the area. There is a large car park which is often very busy. You could spend hours in this Tesco's as there is so much to choose from. This Tesco's has the widest selection of food out of all the Tesco's in the area although this would fit as like I said it is the biggest. It has a big clothing section which sells womens, mens and kids clothing. It also has a jewelery section. There are whole isles devoted to books, cds, dvds, greeting cards, magazines, party ideas, sports equipment, electrical equipment, kitchenwear, bedding and housewear. The store can get very busy as it has a large catchment area. The staff always seem pleasant and friendly.
Typical Tesco Store food wise, good selection of clothes. got 2 pairs of shoes for £20.00.
expensive compared to other supermarkets in town and seems to mainly sell junk food and sweets

I love the chain: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf.
The coffee is fresh and smooth and delicious. Any other CB&TL gets 4 to 5 stars from me.
However, my experience at this particular store was not good. At all. 
My mother and I got out to coffee to catch up several times a week, and we usually go to starbucks. On this particular day we headed to CB&TL for "something new". Since we're not regulars, it took us a minute to order. There was no line, but the barista (guy) was visably irratated and rolling his eyes. I inquired as to whether or not my mother could try a sample of the tea latte to see if she liked it, and while the girl at the register was nice and tried to offer a sample of just the tea, her male coworker interruped and said "no, no we don't" and immediately turned away. The whole experience was less than savory.
The cherry on top? The guy was clearly the supervisor.

Great coffee, not so great customer service.

Coffee Bean is another chain option to Starbucks on the west coast.  I'm not going to lie  I kind of like their frozen caramel latte, I also go to Starbucks a couple times a week.  The baristas here are sweet and efficient and actually get you your drink as fast as possible.

I rarely give any 5 stars. And this one is among those. So, if you're a coffee fanatic, don't kill me. This specific caffeinated-buzz chain-establishment hasn't fail me.  They're very consistence with their espresso. Even in 115 degree heat I'll still stop by for some percolated drinks.
Erika's class was amazing! Absolutely impressed with my first class. The energy and atmosphere can't be match!! I'm signing up ASAP and bringing some friends!
Great, friendly place to work out. The Staff is great. I like that it is affordable for any budget.

This place has changed my life! Started Zumba because I had heard it was an excellent work out but didn't feel like a workout because it was dance! I was needing to shed a few pounds for an upcoming wedding. I was skeptical at first because I am not the workout type. Sandy and Jessica were warm and welcoming on my first day. I was a newbie and knew nothing. They made me feel comfortable and like I was part of the Z family. This was in June.... Since then, I have become addicted! It's a wonderful stress reliever and the people are what keep me going back! Oh... And it does work... The pounds drop off!
This is my home away from home. I love the instructors, the atmosphere and the energy! I have Zumbad many places and am an instructor myself. This place is the best!

If you want your workout to feel like a party then this is the place for you. I've only been here once and it was for their "happy hour" special on Friday for only $4. That's the drop in rate; there is no commitment or anything but they do make you sign a waiver. The are located in dingy and run down shopping center but once you get inside it is a very upbeat and friendly atmosphere. From the schedule on their website it looks like they offer a variety of different Zumba classes but the one I went to was mostly hip hop. They are trying to make it fun and so during the class they crank the music up really loud and there are all kinds of flashing lights like in a nightclub. This was a little too much for me and by the time I left I had a headache. I've taken zumba classes other places without all the hoopla and I really enjoy it. Studio Z was a good workout so I might try it again sometime. I probably would only do the monthly option if they added other cardio group fitness classes besides zumba. But if you just want a good zumba class to augment your fitness regimen, you can't beat their prices on the drop in rates.

I attended a bridal shower here and it was beautiful! The wine was great, we loved the "ho' in the garden" and one of the semi-dry reds, it started with a C. The pricing was extremely affordable, around $15/bottle.  You get to taste up to 5 wines on  the house and then choose. They have 
tons of cute memorabilia, wine bags, to-go cups, etc. There is a super cute, white gazebo out back with beautiful landscape and flowers for photos. 

Cindy & Greg went above and beyond to make sure all the guests were taken care of. I would definitely recommend looking here for a bridal shower or event.
